Reviews.Title: More than I expected!
Reviews.Author: Tryin_hard "tryin_hard"
Reviews.Content: This thing is great!  Has lots of features and was fairly simple to connect.  Some things to know, though.  You should go to itunes and download the free Remote for iOS app before setting it all up.  Also the way to "mirror" what you see on your ipad is supported by enabling the Home Sharing section under the Computer icon on apple tv.  Also, in order to see your control for Airplay on your ipad place your finger on the bottom of your screen and swipe up fast and it'll bring up your Airplay control panel so you can start mirroring things from the device to the TV.  I realize most Apple people already know this but it took me a long time to research all this out! Hope this helps someone else.

Reviews.Title: Must have
Reviews.Author: cap045
Reviews.Content: If you are going to use your tv as a monitor to watch online tv, THIS IS A MUST HAVE.  I haven't owned it long, but well worth the money.  My wife is now thinking about cancelling our TV service.  We spend $25 on TV now, we'd pay for the Apple TV is as little as 4 months.  I should state that I'm a PC lover.... but Apple is starting to win me over.

Reviews.Title: 3 Apple TV's, 2 different experiences.
Reviews.Author: R. Trejo
Reviews.Content: I purchased my first Apple TV a year ago.  Pretty much DOA out of the box.  It kept dropping the connection to iTunes.  It was impressed Tech support (US based, I think even in CA) answered the phone late Saturday afternoon, really knew his stuff, and was able to walk me through alot of different trouble shooting.  I learned many of the internet providers have a firewall system that interferes with the AppleTV, so the first thing we did was call AT&T; and reconfigure firewall setting.  BUST.  The second thing we did was try to update the hardware.  Since we couldn't connect long enough to complete the update, I had to go purchase a mini-USB cable (not included) to do a wired connection and update through iTunes.  BUST.  Keep in mind this took several weeks of troubleshooting and testing and retesting.  I was ready to throw in the towel.Tech finally suggested I had a bad unit and made an appointment for me the next day to go to the Apple store and swap it out.  The unit I received was new and had been tested by Apple and all the updates had already been installed for me.  Took it home and worked flawlessly just like I had expected it to when I first opened it several weeks prior.I will say I was very impressed with Apple's extensive service for a cheap $99 product.Over the year, my family has migrated more and more to the AppleTV and use it quite a bit.  My kids both asked for Apple TV's for Christmas, and I was able to ditch three U-Verse boxes.  With free HiDef broadcast TV, and all the options available on AppleTV, my kids are very happy.  The second and third Apple TV's I purchased worked flawlessly out of the box, have been running for over a month with moderate to heavy use and no issues.  They all connect to one iTunes account, which made setting all the parental controls super easy.My understanding is you can connect up to 8 AppleTV's to one iTunes account in one house.  I have found streaming movies lags when streaming three different AppleTV's at once, and I have 18mbps internet service.  We don't usually stream three movies at once, but I was curious to test the performance..I primarily purchased the AppleTV to manage the 2500+ mp4 movies I've collected and swapped with friends over the years.  I must admit I was not prepared for all of the extra features the AppleTV offers.The remote is not to my taste.  It's way too small and gets lost way to easily, especially with kids (- 1 star).  But any iPhone or iPad can control any AppleTV, and I can control any AppleTV from pretty much anywhere in the house, including sending live video to my kids TV's via Airplay.  (+1 star)the AppleTV remote must have a direct line of sight to the AppleTV to work.  You cannot tape it to the back of the TV and expect it to work.  It MIGHT if you have reflective walls, but you should have that expectation.  It is small, and some double sided tape worked real well mounting it to the top or bottom of some wall mounted flat screens.You can change the settings and remove icons/apps from the home screen that you don't want on there (customizable).You can set up parental controls and passwords to restrict content, compatible with MPAA ratings and US TV ratings.There is no Pandora app (yet), but we simply run Pandora from an iPhone or iPad and Airplay it to the AppleTV.

} } } Length:: 6:25 MinsI own both the Apple TV 2nd generation and 3rd generation. For most people, the 3rd generation is the way to go. It offers improved performance in several key areas over the 2nd generation Apple TV. But if you want to jailbreak the AppleTV, you can't with the 3rd Gen so you'd want to find the 2nd Generation.From an appearance standpoint the two generations look identical. It's what is inside that makes the big difference.Here are the notable improvements in the 3rd Gen Apple TV. ➺ it supports 1080p/720p, whereas the 2nd Gen only supports 720p ➺ it has a faster on-board chip, the A5 vs the A4 chip in the 2nd Gen. ➺ it supports 5GHz networking whereas the 2nd Gen only supports 2.4GHzThe faster A5 chip really makes a noticeable difference in navigating the interface. And of course since the Apple TV now supports 1080p and has 5GHz networking, the A5 chip helps enable that higher spec performance.The back of the Apple TV has, from left to right: ➺ AC plug ➺ HDMI port ➺ MicroUSB port ➺ Optical Digital output which supports Dolby 5.1 Surround Sound ➺ 10/100 Base-T EthernetIncluded in the box is an AC power cord and an Apple Remote (IR.) Concerning the remote, since it is infrared, the AppleTV has to be able to "see" the remote or you have to bounce it off walls or ceiling to control the AppleTV. The best alternative is to use the app and control the AppleTV from your iPhone.The available content on the Apple TV has been greatly expanded with this newer generation. Here are the highlights of great content available: ➺ Netflix - ➺ Hulu Plus - paid content ➺ HBO Go - access to HBO programs if you subscribe to HBO already ➺ PBS ➺ ESPN ➺ ABC - doesn't yet work with Time Warner Cable ➺ NBA - premium but some free content ➺ NHL - premium but some free content ➺ Crackle - movies and tv shows similar to Netflix ➺ Bloomberg ➺ skyNEWS ➺ Trailers ➺ Weather ➺ KORTV - Korean station that offers video on demand - free and premium content ➺ Disney Channel - doesn't yet work with Time Warner Cable ➺ Disney XD - doesn't yet work with Time Warner Cable ➺ Disney Junior - doesn't yet work with Time Warner Cable ➺ Smithsonian ➺ Yahoo Screen ➺ iCloud Photos ➺ iMovie Theater - iMovie projects that you share to the theater ➺ Podcasts - ➺ YouTube - video sharing ➺ Flickr - photo sharing ➺ Vevo - music videos ➺ Vimeo - video sharing ➺ MLB.TV - Major League Baseball - some free content but a premium subscription is $24.99/yr ➺ Qello - HD concert films and music documentaries - $4.99/mo ➺ Crunchyroll - anime on demand ➺ MLS - Major League Soccer ➺ Radio ➺ WSJ Live - programming from Wall Street JournalThat's quite a line-up and I'm certain Apple will be adding more content as time goes by. Keep in mind that some of the content is paid content but much is free and most content will require you to set up an account whether the content is free or paid.In addition to all that streaming content the Apple TV also provides some additional benefits to people in the Apple ecosystem. It has AirPlay and consequently it is now possible to stream to your HDTV your MacBook Desktop, iPad or iPhone. It can essentially mirror whatever is on your device and stream that to your HDTV. This is fantastic for presentations, sharing slideshows, tutoring people and so much more.But even more interesting is the fact that you can now extend your desktop of your Mac computer to your HDTV. It's as if you now have two monitors hooked up to your computer. Once you start enjoying that feature I'll bet you'll be hooked.I love my Apple TV. The faster processor just makes the thing faster and it's been rock solid in performance too. Setup is a breeze. I also have a ROKU but since getting the 3rd Gen Apple TV, I rarely use the ROKU... there is no need to really.

Reviews.Title: The latest upgrade assuaged my doubts.
Reviews.Author: R. Fidelman "MIS Guy"
Reviews.Content: Initially, I was disappointed in the Apple TV (ATV). Every show, every item cost something! I felt I was on a budget airline. I originally purchased it because of an Internet article which stated that PBS was coming. What I saw after installation was old shows which wanted $1.99-$9.99 to watch.Then came an Internet update two days ago which added a PBS icon to the main screen. Now, everything under that icon is free! This is what I was expecting in the first place; I just didn't wait long enough, it seems. Although the resolution is not HD, it's OK. I still don't know how much of a lag there will be between actual broadcast and ATV availability (Downton Abbey, e.g.) but my impression of ATV has gone from one star to 4. I hope they introduce more free stuff.

Reviews.Title: Love it. Get it if you want to save hundreds of dollars on cable bills.
Reviews.Author: J. Neuman
Reviews.Content: Love it. I cut the cable cord, and this thing has saved me hundreds of dollars so far, and as the months and years go on, it will be thousands of dollars saved.  With the internet and Airplay, and the apps it has (and is constantly adding) I'll never need cable again and their absurd prices.

Reviews.Title: Has met my expectations and more!
Reviews.Author: Angela
Reviews.Content: My husband and I decided to cancel our cable/satellite and move to strictly stream our programming from the internet and Netflix. I opted for Apple TV instead of subscribing to something like Hulu Plus. There are, of course, pros and cons to both options. For me it boiled down to not wanting another monthly subscription so I am sacrificing on some content.Regarding my experience with Apple TV thus far...installation was extremely simple! I was up and running within 10 minutes. The first thing I did was bring up one of my major network apps on my iPad (abc/cbs/nbc) and using Airplay and the mirroring technology stream an episode of one of my favorite shows. Worked like a charm! (I did have to Google the steps on this because it wasn't listed in the manual how to set up Airplay, but it was very simple).  This was one of my main reasons for buying Apple TV, so I could stop watching my current seasons of shows on small screens like my iPad and iPhone (or computer). The picture was crystal clear and once it had a solid connection, it played flawlessly (a few hiccups at the start).After that, I brought up Netflix. This was just an added bonus for me that Netflix streaming was included, I already had this capability through my Samsung BluRay player and my Wii. But let me tell you, the Netflix experience using the Apple TV is stellar compared to the Wii and BluRay player! It connects extremely quickly, much quicker than my BluRay player and the look and feel is just outstanding.There are a lot of apps already available with Apple TV but be forewarned, you need a programming subscription with a major provider for a lot of the content. I knew this going in, so this didn't disappoint me. But there is still a lot that you can leverage: PBS, The Weather Channel, Radio, YouTube and more. Let alone anything in your iTunes.The one con is that iTunes rentals and purchases for movies, TV shows/series, etc. is pretty inflated, at least for my area of the country. Between RedBox, Netflix and brick & mortar rental stores, you can rent shows for much less than iTunes offers. The convenience is nice however, if that is worth the inflation to you.Some features I recently learned about but have not used yet: there is a special connection with Yahoo that you can use. I want to explore this more. You can also use your iDevice as a remote by downloading the Apple TV Remote app. I downloaded the app but haven't used this yet. The remote it comes with is nice and simple, but very small so downloading the app is a good back-up plan in the event the remote gets lost (I have a 4 & 5 year old!).I'm looking forward to the updates that Apple makes to Apple TV because as awesome as it is now, I know it is only going to get better. And for $99, your ROI will be quick if your eliminating a cable/satellite subscription like me.

Reviews.Title: Cut the Cord!
Reviews.Author: ramir san diego
Reviews.Content: With the price of cable/ satellite service....I was debating/ researching which streaming option to use.  Looks like Blueray option was out due to too many complaints about connectivity..it was down to Appletv 3 or Roku 3.  I guess either would do..but I read a review somewhere stating the ApleTV had a more stable Wifi connectivity and thats what I needed.  My router was on the 2nd floor of the house and really needed wifi stability.Set-up was easy enough. Just turn on the unit/ plug it in and follow onscreen instructions.  Took a little while for the initial boot-up/ set-up.  Typing the password for the wifi set-up was a little challenging since I was not used todoing it via the remote (probably needs a keyboard accessory in the future)...and the typed character was converted to * after a few secs...so you really need to know your password.  It will rememebr the set-up after everything is set-up so you do this only once.  Just Be careful with the very small remote...very large chance to misplace it , specially with small kids using it.Comes with a lot of links (mostly need account with itunes) to purchase stuff...access to Youtube , podcasts, Smithsonian  and weather channel were free.Really need either a HULUplus or Netfilx subscription depending on what you regularly watch.  Beats paying $70++/ month for DirecTV which has 90% of the channels you dont watch....and clouds don't interfere with the signal.**NOTE: make sure the router is on first before you turn on the Appltv or else it will take a long time to do a re-set-up/ re-link to the router.***SO far it has been great, after a month of no huge cable/ satellite

Reviews.Title: Perfect if You Are Already Invested in the Apple iOS Ecosystem
Reviews.Author: John Keitz
Reviews.Content: I have a SmartTV, so adding Apple TV was a bit superfluous. Nevertheless, there are several features that made the purchase worthwhile for me.  To begin with, the whole family has a wide range of Apple devices, from iPod to iPhone to iPad, and the main feature I was interested in was Airplay.  Using Airplay, you can take whatever is on your screen and mirror it to the TV (this only works with the iPhone4S and later items, so the iPhone 4 and the iPod were left out).  You can also send the sound from your iOS device to your TV and from there to the surround sound system using Airplay.  Some games are designed for Airplay use as well.  Sky Gamblers is a good example of this.  You see the main view on the TV, and you have the secondary view, in this case your radar, on your phone.  There is a bit of lag from time to time, but you can get used to it.  Likewise, you can use Airplay to show photos and videos from your iOS device.  Unfortunately, in order to prevent “buffering” issues while playing back, Apple TV buffers much of the video beforehand, which means a long wait from when you press play to when you see video playing.Apple TV offers many other features, but I find that I rarely use them.  It is connected into iTunes, so your iTunes content is available to you, but other than that, I find most of the features are already present on my SmartTV.  For example, while Apple TV has Netflix, and a very nice interface at that, my TV has a Netflix button that has me in Netflix very quickly.  Other things like NHL Game Center are also available, but again, easier on my SmartTV.Apple TV is missing some things that you may expect from a SmartTV add-in box (like Roku).  There is no Pandora, Slacker, etc.  On the other hand, it can play anything from your iPhone, so you can just fire up Slacker from there instead.  Also, the remote is terrible.  Tiny, oversensitive, just not very good.  Fortunately, you can download the Remote app from the App Store (free) and control your Apple TV from your iOS device instead.  Another drawback, all it includes is the power cable.  You will need your own HDMI cable to attach it to your TV and you will need your own TOSLINK cable to connect it to your stereo (unless you use HDMI for that too).  Bad move on Apple’s part, since it won’t just work out of the box.  HDMI cables are cheap, and it would have been a good idea to include one, just to have people not have to go out to get one after they open the box and discover there isn’t one.Bottom line, Apple TV is great if you are already into the Apple Ecosystem.  If you have iPhones, pods, and pads, this is the gadget for you.  If you already have a SmartTV, then you already have most of the features here.  If you don’t have a SmartTV and are looking for an add-in to give you those functions, you may do better with a Roku or the like, but you won’t have the Apple functionality (Airplay and iTunes).

Reviews.Title: Excellent Product
Reviews.Author: Paul L. Thwaites
Reviews.Content: This is a must have accessory for anybody that has a Hi Def TV and iTunes on their computer. The simple ability to stream to my new Hi Def TV was reason alone to get this product and the ease of setup and use makes this the best $100.00 that I have spent for a long time.  OK, so I am a beginner to Mac products (I am a die-hard PC user) but I would not even begin to look for something negative to say. Sure, other more experienced persons might have wished for more but for me its GREAT.Ease Of Setup: 10Ease Of Use: 10Will it get me looking at other Mac products?  Definitely!

Reviews.Title: Not really a peer to other home media players at all
Reviews.Author: Jeffrey W. Webber "Jeff Webber"
Reviews.Content: Like everything Apple makes, this device is lovely and elegant and intuitive to use. If you're content buying things from the iTunes store and streaming videos from its short list of approved partners, you will probably adore this device. I was really disappointed. And I will tell you why.The problem is that if you'd like to do ANYTHING else, no matter how standard it might be on similar devices, you are out of luck.Want to watch that Blu-Ray you ripped into Xvid/avi? Nope. An .mkv file... half the tvs and Blu-Ray players out today can do that. Not your ATV. It only plays H264 stuff ripped into its formats. How about that camera phone video you made of your kid? Hardly. Maybe you made that video in one of the short list of approved formats. I hope you have it on a Mac or a PC running bloated old iTunes, because your shared network folders mean nothing to ATV. What if I just put it on a thumb drive and plug it in? Sorry, no USB ports. So if you're on Linux or you just don't like iTunes, you're S.O.L. I'm told there are elaborate ways to convert files and funnel them over from iTunes, but when competing devices offer plug n' play, how is that not an annoying hassle?How about streaming stuff... Maybe you'll just watch Hulu. Nope. (EDIT: Hulu has been added.) Amazon Instant Video? Nope. Blockbuster On Demand? Nope. Maybe listen to Pandora? Nope. Spotify? Don't kid yourself. Even my phone can play stuff off a UPnP server. Can't Apple TV? Nope again. No device has every service, every file format, but the ATV only has the ones that don't interfere with their moneymaking efforts. You could try and jailbreak it to get it to be more flexible... but there isn't a working jailbreak for Apple TV 3.If you browse through other compact media players, you're going to find that things like mkv/xvid support, USB ports, Hulu, and Pandora aren't just available, they're increasingly standard. Half the Blu-Ray players coming out today can do much of this stuff, many of the tvs, too.But even though the iPhone offers similar functionality to competing phones, the iPad offers similar features to other tablets, and Apple laptops serve similar needs to PC laptops, the Apple TV isn't really analogous to other home media players at all. It lacks most of the functionality those devices have in common and exists primarily as an aesthetically pleasing way of expanding your existing relationship with Apple and its partners onto your television set. If this is all you need/want, consider this a four star review. But for me, looking for an all purpose media player, I felt really let down.If you want your media player to play YOUR media, your way or if you're interested in services that have any competing interest to the iTunes store, best look elsewhere. It's not that this is a bad device, it's just that it's not really a true peer to similar devices.As a post-script, please let me add that I'm not antagonistic to Apple products AT ALL. I have an iPad I adore. I also have a Windows desktop, an Android phone, and a Linux laptop. I'm just looking for the best stuff. I'm not pushing any OS-specific agenda. If you're an all-Apple-all-the-time person, you may love the Apple TV. But I wanted to offer my review for people who aren't.

Reviews.Title: Nice design quality but not useful enough for me!
Reviews.Author: L. Breda "L."
Reviews.Content: I bought the apple tv for my living room and bedroom so we could cut the cable cord but still have entertainment at our fingertips.I quickly fell in love with the smooth interface but realized it was not going to be a cheap alternative to cable.I think the apple tv is a waste of money. I bought a Mac mini and use that in the living room as it can play Hulu desktop and Netflix in addition to my iTunes library and of course since its a full blown computer it can play movies and shows of almost any format. It can also stream pandora and I can show my photos on the big screen.I bought a roku player for my bedroom that sits next to my apple tv so I can play Hulu, netflix, pandora, and amazon instant streaming,and honestly I hardly ever touch the apple tv.The apple tv can be used to stream downloaded content from your iTunes library to your tv but it's a pain to get the content in apple tv format. With seasons of new shows ranging from 15-35 dollars on iTunes I would much rather pay 7.99 a month for unlimited access to Hulu plus. If I desperately need a show or movie I don't jump I buy via iTunes. It can often be found cheaper from a different source like Netflix or amazon streaming.If I could do it all over again I would only buy a Mac mini for the living room and a roku for the bedroom and call it good.***update**** Apple TV now has Hulu plus! It has now eliminated my need for my rocku player which is now set up in the guest bedroom! With the addition of Hulu plus, and it already being able to get Netflix this little box is just what I need! My only problem now is if I download a movie from my computer it has to be in correct format to play from Apple TV which can be time consuming at times to convert! Change my rating to four star!!!!!!  On a final note Apple TV has cool extras a good example beamy live streaming of the presidential debates by WSJ very cool and convenient.

Reviews.Title: Love my Apple TV do wish it would stream amazon prime videos tho
Reviews.Author: honest opinion
Reviews.Content: I originally bought a chromecast and after hours and hours of messing with it I got smart and bought the Apple TV! I am so happy with this product! Works great! My only complaint is I DO wish it would have an app to stream amazon prime videos.....other than that, it's amazing!

Reviews.Title: Very limited
Reviews.Author: jim
Reviews.Content: Was thinking there would be a lot more that cane done with device. Basically it is ITunes for your TV.

Reviews.Title: Love it!
Reviews.Author: Nano45TA
Reviews.Content: This little box is pure entertainment for your home. If you have an iPhone or iPad it's 100x better because of AirPlay. I play my games on my hd from my phone wirelessly with no lag at all. Apple can't be beat! To top it off, I bought this for only $60 brand new.

Reviews.Title: Great For AirPlay, but could use more Content...
Reviews.Author: Irineo Placido-Lopez
Reviews.Content: Ok, so I bought this at a Best Buy a couple of weeks ago and it is a great addition to my apple inventory. I use both, Apple and Android so I don't like one over the other. Now for the main review on the Apple TV...I will separate this review into sections for your convenience...==== Air Play ====Personally, this was the main reason why I bought the Apple TV. I own two iPod Touches and an iPad and I use the Air Play on the Apple TV a lot. I can easily steam over to the Apple TV without any problems and it is really easy to do. I end up mirroring Youtube videos onto my TV Instead of watching them on the small screen. This is probably one of the best things about the Apple TV. If you don't have other Apple Devices and are just looking for a media box to stream netflix, huluplus, etc on your TV I would recommend buying a different product instead as they tend to have more features to them then the Apple TV.==== 1080P Content ====When renting or buying movies in the iTunes Store you can watch everything in 1080P! That is Full HD! You can also watch previously owned movies on your Apple TV so you don't buy them over again you just start enjoying on your TV Instead of an iPod/iPhone/iPad screen.==== Content/Channels ====The main downside to an Apple TV is the amount of content/channels it supports. It doesn't have as many channels as other media players like the Sony SMP-N200. If you want something cheaper, but with more channels and don't plan on using AirPlay then I would go with other options; however, if you do own other Apple Devices that are capable of AirPlay then this is a Great Buy! You can now have everything that is shown on your iDevice's screen on the screen of your TV! That is what makes the Apple TV such a popular product.Overall This is a great product that I really enjoy using and it adds to a great addition to my other Apple devices. I wish it would have more channels/content, but it does balance out since the Apple TV has AirPlay. I rate this product 4 stars out of 5 stars.I hope this review helped you out!

Reviews.Title: Beautiful, ultra responsive and efficient. Seamless content integration with all your apple devices.
Reviews.Author: karma-rules
Reviews.Content: Highly recommend it. Air Play feature alone justifies the price.  This is what Apple is all about. I can even share my Mac (with advance preview of upcoming Mountain Lion OSX) screen on to the TV with a single click. Netflix is top notch too. The included new remote is definitely a huge improvement over the "white acrylic" that came with the first generation apple TVs. Still I am not a huge fan of it. With that said, who needs it any ways. when one can remotely control the Apple TV from my iPhone and iPad.

Reviews.Title: Failed after warranty period - 1 star.
Reviews.Author: Undercross
Reviews.Content: My Apple TV failed after warranty period. You have to pay to get support after that and it was an error code that I couldn't research or fix. I have an iPod 4 and an iPad 2 that I really like but I threw away my just out of warranty tv as it was useless. This was a very sad apple experience for me.

Reviews.Title: A perfect addition...
Reviews.Author: Scott E. Sanders
Reviews.Content: This is a review of the Apple TV MD199LL/A [NEWEST VERSION]For the longest time, I was reluctant about getting an Apple TV since I have a TiVo box and a PC (not a Mac).  But, my brother told me one day how much he uses his, so I decided to give it a try.  I have an iPhone 4s, iPad 2 and an iPod Touch 4th Gen, so I use iTunes A LOT.  I have a rather extensive video collection amassing on my PC as well as close to 18,000 MP3s (all legal I might add).  The Apple TV really has changed the way I view TV now.  The seamless integration of all my various iOS devices with the Apple TV box is nothing short of spectacular.  It opens up the ability to start watching a movie on TV, then continuing the movie on the iPad, iPod Touch or iPhone.  Also, let's say you are out running errands and you are listening to music on your iPod, when you arrive at home, all you have to do is select Apple TV from the menu on the music player and Viola! You can listen to your music through your home entertainment system.  With all the features this little box offers, I now wonder why I ever hesitated to buy one.With the newest version of this box, you can now view streams in full 1080P HiDef. It also gives you access to the internet, so you can find out of town radio stations, your favorite YouTube or Vimeo videos, watch movies on Netflix, stream pictures to your TV with Flickr or PhotoStream, and lots of other cool and useful things.  Now, I know there are some people out there who think that a TiVo and negates te need for an Apple TV or, vice versa, but let me assure you, they are complimentary of each other.  With TiVo you can record shows off the TV and store them either on the TiVo box itself, or on a network-connected PC/Mac with the TiVo Desktop software.  The Apple TV allows you to stream all forms of multimedia from your computer or the internet.With Apple TV, the realm of digital media becomes more of a close reality.  I am very pleased with my purchase and would recommend it to anyone who enjoys collecting movies, music, or any form of media, on the computer.  Or, if you just enjoy renting a movie for the weekend, this is for you too.  The selection is by far larger than any cable television's On Demand or Pay-Per-View content offerings.Not really a complaint, more of a suggestion for Apple.  The Apple TV can only be connected to one TV.  It would be great if it could be connected wirelessly to multiple TVs so you could watch your favorite shows in any room in your house, on any connected TV.

Reviews.Title: Where are the channels?!
Reviews.Author: D. Ezzio "James Ezzio"
Reviews.Content: The unit itself sets up very easily and the layout for Netflix is the best I have ever seen. However, Netflix and Hulu are about all this thing has to offer outside of what you purchase from Apple. Unless you have a giant iTunes collection I would recommend getting a Roku player instead because it has over 600 channels compared to around 10 on Apple TV.

Reviews.Title: Great addition at a reasonable price
Reviews.Author: Yesenia
Reviews.Content: I want to start this review by stating that I am not an Apple elitist. I prefer and love my PC so I will give my best unbiased review of the AppleTV. My reason for buying the AppleTV was three fold: (1) I wanted the ability to integrate my home theater system with my computer media (music, movies, and photos) both wired and wirelessly, (2) I wanted to project what I was doing on my iPad to my television for guests to see without having to look over one persons shoulder, and (3) I wanted to easiest user interface for both my family and guests to be able to use without needing assistance.With those three items in mind, the AppleTV has met each one of my needs. It has the functionality of streaming internet videos as well through Netflix, YouTube, etc... but those are all just icing on the cake. As far as the hardware product itself, the newest version of the AppleTV has added the functionality of 1080p which is why I waited to purchase the newest model. Apple was behind the market in this category as other competitor products had 1080p capabilities long before. A quick rundown:Pros:(1) The accessibility of integrating your entire home theater system with your personal media collection from your computer or iPad.(2) The ability to mirror the iPad display for everyone to see on the TV.(3) The ease of the user interface for first time users.(4) As a plus, the size of the product is extremely small and easy to install. Only requires a power outlet and an HDMI cable.Cons: Apple's locked down software only allows for videos in your iTunes account to be viewed on the AppleTV. Knowing that before I purchased, I did not take away a star.Summary: I knew what I was getting before I made my purchase of the new AppleTV and it did not disappoint. In fact, because of the ease of installation, use of interface, and quality build of product it has met and in some ways exceeded my expectations. I await the day when the PC market will produce similar products with superior user interfaces.

Reviews.Title: People who claim fraud are uninformed
Reviews.Author: T. Williams
Reviews.Content: The Apple TV's that are selling for $250 are the ATV2's, NOT ATV3's. The ATV2 is only 720p, but can be jail broken, allowing the user to add additional apps not available on the ATV3, which cannot be jail broken. I have had an ATV2 for almost 3 years now, and have it jail broken with ATV flash which allows me to do quite a bit that the ATV3 cannot do.  I paid $99 when i bought mine, and would not let it go, even for $250. The scarcity plus increased functionality has driven the price up.

Reviews.Title: We were able to finally watch the shows we chose to.  goodbye cable.
Reviews.Author: Michael Griffin
Reviews.Content: Great choices when the grand children visit.  Highly recommend it to stream from your I Pad.  We have gotten rid of cable.

Reviews.Title: WOW! This thing works great!
Reviews.Author: Megrier "G. Meir"
Reviews.Content: Model 1469I bought this not really knowing what to expect but once I hooked it up, it basically leads you through the simple setup procedure with onscreen prompts. Once you have it running you have access to a ton of programing and it comes in clearer than my cable signal! Here's the best part, I can stream Amazon Prime movies FREE using the "Air Play" feature on my iPad 2 and/or iPhone 4!!I was wondering if "Air Play" would work in this way and it does! Once you setup the Apple TV all of your mac devices will show you an "Air Play" icon in and obvious area of the application you are using. When you press the icon you will begin seeing what ever was on your device screen on your TV! Works perfect! The sound is great too, in stereo! I watched a movie last night streaming from my iPhone!! I think there is also supposed to be a "mirror" feature of Air Play that lets you see the image both on your device and your TV but apparently, it doesn't work on my older devices. So, what you see on your device is a black screen with a message that says "Your movie is playing on Apple TV."One issue to beware of, in my understanding, is that the "Air Play" feature is not be available on computers that are older than mid 2011 except for iTunes. So, I have been streaming movies most of the time from my iPad. Not sure why Air Play will not work with older computers unless it is because I have not installed the latest OS X. I am running  OS X 10.8.5 and the AirPlay icon will not show up when I stream an Amazon Prime movie from either of my mid 2010 iMacs. I can however, get AirPlay to work though iTunes and can play anything in my iTunes library through Air Play from my mid 2010 iMacs.Of course you can also rent or even buy movies from iTunes also. It has Netflix and hulu too!When I first setup the apple TV, I had some problems getting it to play a movie without loosing the signal and then waiting for it to re-buffer again to begin playing. I found out that where I had my TV in relation to my wifi was causing it to receive a weak signal. I have my wifi coming from my Apple Time Capsule in the basement office of our home while the TV is up one floor. I checked the signal strength by using my laptop and placing it near the tv and going online and doing an internet speed test. I found that I was only getting about 3 mbps! Once I moved the Apple TV over to the other side of the TV stand and moved it forward about 6 inches the signal jumped up to 25 mbs! That solved the problem and we have since been watching movies every night!I have since installed an Apple Airport Express which can be used to boost your wifi signal from one area of your home to the next. It was super easy to setup and it simply joined my network on the Time Capsule when I plugged it in and asked me if I wanted to use it to expand my wifi network. Now I have a much stronger signal in the upper area of our home!If you have all Apple products like we do with 3 computers an iPad and Two iPhones, this is a must have! Just get it and enjoy!

Reviews.Title: Its Apple and it Works
Reviews.Author: Mike60
Reviews.Content: The Apple TV has grown from its early days when it had a hard drive, to now being just a streamer.  It cost much more back when it ran a version of Tiger.  Now it is a streamer and it makes it very easy to get movies and music off you computer and on to the TV.  Its interface changes with updates, Apple has added more channels, but nothing like Roku.  I have both,  Roku is nuts with adding channels. Roku is a cheaper unit, does more then Apple TV, is not as polished in terms of interface, but it can handle Netflix,redbox,Vdu, HBO, etc, etc.  If you are an Apple person with Ios toys then you will love this.  You might still like the Roku because if you are computer savy, there is more you can do with.

Reviews.Title: I love it!
Reviews.Author: cinji
Reviews.Content: I purchased this because my tv is a few years old, still good, and Hdmi capable, so I didn't want to yet purchase a smart tv. I got it set up easily, with a little help, and it's great so far--Netflix, Huku, YouTube all in one place. I only wish it amazon prime video, but I can do that from my iPad easily.

Reviews.Title: strange i got a used one
Reviews.Author: Chinook
Reviews.Content: when i logged into Netflix, it had another user account already activated.i tried it and sure enough i logged in under their acount and they had their users set up!of course i logged out and re-entered Netflix under my credentials.but nonetheless, Amazon represented this a new and i got a used one.not sure how i feel about Amazon listing it as new yet selling an obviously returned unit.

Reviews.Title: We replaced Cable TV with Apple TV
Reviews.Author: petergar "petergar"
Reviews.Content: Our family replaced our costly basic cable subscription with two new Apple TVs.  We use the Apple TV to watch Netflix and Hulu's paid streaming services which are far less expensive than basic cable.  We also love accessing our iTunes Music and Movie libraries from our Mac computers wirelessly on the Apple TV as well as directly from the iTunes Store.  I especially enjoy using the Apple Remote app on my iPhone as the remote control for our Apple TVs rather than the remote control unit included with the Apple TV.  The only reason I gave it 4 stars rather than 5 Stars is because we would like to continue to see more content providers, especially no cost content providers, added to the already growing list of content available on the Apple TV.  Most recently, I was happy to see PBS was added as a no cost content provider on the Apple TV.  Netflix and Hulu have plenty of children's programs, so our kids enjoy the Apple TV as much as my wife and I.  It's much more than a TV, like the iPhone is much more than a phone.  Although I personally don't watch too many movies or TV shows, personally, my greatest enjoyment of the Apple TV is streaming music, photos, and home videos straight from my iPhone right onto the Apple TV!

Reviews.Title: Great
Reviews.Author: GG
Reviews.Content: Yes, I'm an Apple fan, but that's not to suggest I like everything Cupertino puts out.But this is truly a great product.  Small, slick, and is the perfect box (as least in my opinion) to watch Netflix.  It sets up fast and is really idiot proof - good for me I assure you.I don't use all of the apps, but there are several worth checking out.  I really enjoy the PBS app for watching programs like Nova.  Also, the Airplay is very nice to have to stream music, and mirror my iPad for Amazon Prime videos.  I hope everybody will play nice at some point and Apple will include the Amazon app at some point, or Amazon allowing an app to be used.I can attest to the wireless functionality being very good.  I live in remote Alaska - no roads in or out where I live - and there is no broadband.  My internet is all done by satellite, so you can imagine the speeds.  I usually get around .512 - .520gbps.  If you don't understand the technical reference - think dial-up on a good day.So, that said, I still can stream Netflix without interruption, and the Apple TV can do it all wirelessly.  You cannot go wrong with this product.

Reviews.Title: Thumbs up!
Reviews.Author: Lauren
Reviews.Content: I love this thing. Well worth the money. (especially if you have alternate Apple devices that you can AirPlay with). It's very compact, very simple to navigate, and a great alternative to cable.

Reviews.Title: Nice replacement for cable
Reviews.Author: Stacie
Reviews.Content: When I purchased my MacBook Pro - this last August, I decided to spend an extra $100 to get the Apple TV as well. Best $100 I ever spent.First off - you need an HDMI cable to hook it up that does not come in the box but if you're anything like us, you have extras. Right out of the box it was extremely easy to set up. I was reading some reviews about limited channels but I found that Netflix, Hulu Plus, YouTube, Pandora and iTunes is more than enough. There are more channels - but I have yet to check them out. We share an iTunes library with my husbands family so we have over $2000 worth of movies on this little guy. We also opted out of getting cable and use this for all of our shows.My husband and I both have iPhones as well and the Apple remote app is great! Works just like remote it comes with and its nice to have more than 1 remote we can use.I also have a MacBook and airplay is wonderful. Like I said we don't have cable but I do have a few shows that aren't on Hulu or Netflix like Catfish. So I go to MTV.com - find my episode, press the airplay symbol on my Mac and in like 12 seconds I'm streaming on my tv wirelessly.Could not be more impressed and I will definitely be getting a second one for our living room as well!

Reviews.Title: If you are an Apple fan, it's a must buy
Reviews.Author: L. Bryan
Reviews.Content: It you already own Apple devices, this is a must add to the collection. It was purchased as a birthday gift for my husband and he loves it. I'm not sure how often it will be used as we already have a ton of other electronics but it does do great streaming and everyone seems to love the Netflix app on it. It's an Apple product, how can you go wrong with it.

Reviews.Title: Far superior to Samsung Smart TV
Reviews.Author: Terry A. Simpson
Reviews.Content: There is no comparison to the ease of use of this device compared to a Samsung Smart TV and the cost is less than the premium for the Smart TV. Setup is a snap, you can use your phone or iPad as a remote, and the software has Apple's trademark ease of use and sharp design. Save money by getting the dumb TV and plugging this nifty little unit into it. As a side note, the Amazon app has now been updated so you can stream Amazon video through Apple TV using your Iphone, IPad, or Mac . This is a nice addition to the built in apps for Netflix, HBO Go, ESPN, Hulu, Disney, and quite a few others.

Reviews.Title: Just awesome!
Reviews.Author: A. Bapat "Gadget Savvy"
Reviews.Content: I got this delivered about a week back.  Was very very easy to hook it up.  Only thing I thought was if they would include HDMI cable with the package, it would be more ready to use.  Love the fact that I just play things from my iPad/phone and they magically play on my TV.  I even was able to hook it up to my 5.1 Dolby Digital HTS.  It is awesome all the way.. at least now.  If I do see something later worth mentioning, I will update later again.

Reviews.Title: Great way to access wifi tv
Reviews.Author: K. Green
Reviews.Content: The Apple TV is much easier to use than the smart wifi built into our LG TV.  We bought this so that we could use the big screen for our iPad images.  It works great and has a very simple interface.  No problems hooking it into our system.

Reviews.Title: tv at its best
Reviews.Author: D Evans "Dr Data"
Reviews.Content: The apple tv works just as I thought it would. I use the YouTube connection to get video's for my grandson and use the other connections to watch tv shows I missed.  Have not used Netflex or Hulu yet, except for free shows.

Reviews.Title: Bye Bye Cable/Sat TV!!!!!!!
Reviews.Author: R. Patel
Reviews.Content: You will initially feel that there is a huge gap when using this as your only entertainment option, and that cutting Cable/Sat TV was a mistake. THEN, you realize that you were watching a lot of CRAP in the first place! And realize that life is much better with an extra $1000 in your pocket by Xmas time!!! :))

Reviews.Title: Cool product, works as advertised
Reviews.Author: 2LTRSCamaro
Reviews.Content: This is cool if you have other iOS devices, if you don't own any other apple products, I'd suggest looking into a Roku box instead

Reviews.Title: Wish it supported Amazon Instant Video
Reviews.Author: Andrea Polk
Reviews.Content: I have two Roku HD Streaming Player devices streaming Netflix, HuluPlus, and Amazon Instant Video in my household.  Why get an Apple TV?  Apple iPad integration, iTunes library access on my HDTV, and a need for speed!Side by side the Apple TV device blows my Roku away in terms of grabbing streaming content, buffering it, and getting it to play.  I love that!  Apple TV also offers up the cool features of syncing with my iTunes library and AirPlay with my iPad.  I love that too!What I don't love about the Apple TV is that it doesn't support Amazon Instant Video.  Maybe with future upgrades or generations it will, but for now, this newest version doesn't and that gives the advantage to Roku in terms of programming options.Roku also offers a bunch more 'channels' to surf than Apple TV, but Apple TV's ability to stream podcasts from iTunes evens things out for me.If you have HBO, you can use the AirPlay function to stream HBO content via the Apple TV to your HDTV.  AirPlay also allows iPad users to mirror what they are doing on their iPad to an HDTV with Apple TV connected to it.Apple TV gives you options like a plethora of Internet radio stations to listen to, FLICKR, and sports subscription channels.The downside to Apple TV is the price, but despite that, I'm glad I spent nearly double what I paid for my Roku on this device.  It's sleek interface runs smoothly (update it when you hook it up so you have the latest firmware) and quickly, and Netflix, HuluPlus and YouTube look great when played on the Apple TV.With AirPlay (super cool way to stream video from your iPad to your TV) and a free iTunes app called 'Remote', you can play your downloaded movies and TV programs from iTunes via the Apple TV.If you don't have an iTunes account, music library or iPad, you may want to stick with Roku with the bonus of a lower price and Amazon Instant Video.Apple TV is great except for its lack of Amazon syncing and limited channel add-ons.  Despite those faults (and the reason for the 4 out of 5 rating), it's really a fantastic piece of hardware with impressive speed and Apple product integration, making it worth a purchase in my book.7/1/13 - UPDATE:Be sure to do the software update to this device when prompted, or check in settings for the update.  This latest update seems to have helped the speediness of the transitions and optimized the Apple TV.  A slight update to the visual interface is nice too.  Unfortunately, Amazon Instant Video is not yet part of the update.

Reviews.Title: Does what it's supposed to
Reviews.Author: Tyler J
Reviews.Content: This just works. Trying to link your mac computers to your TV and fussing around with 3rd party software that is buffering at inopportune moments in your movie? The apple TV is small, simple, and works great.

Reviews.Title: Terrific
Reviews.Author: Anjali Sharma
Reviews.Content: Works great! If you like watching movies and tv shows on itunes and netflix then Apple TV is for you, if not look elsewhere, Besides limited function of iTunes songs and only being able to see paid content with iTunes you don't have many other options. I don't use it that much but it is handy. Wish Netflix had more shows and movies on it though,

Reviews.Title: Fantastic device... what took me so long?
Reviews.Author: CB
Reviews.Content: I had been debating for over a year whether to get an Apple TV device, but after getting one I don't know what took me so long. If your TV is the focal point of your home entertainment as it is for me, and you're a Mac, iTunes, or iPad user, then this device is awesome. It allows you to play anything you have ever bought or downloaded from iTunes (music, movies, shows, podcasts, etc.) on your TV instantly and wirelessly. If you connect Home Sharing from a computer running iTunes (a PC in my case), you can watch or listen to anything in your iTunes library, regardless of whether you purchased it from iTunes (e.g. ripped CDs or DVDs). But the best part for me was that you can mirror your iPad or other iOS device onto the TV through the built-in Airplay feature. For example, you can listen to Sirius or Pandora through the TV and control it from the iPad wirelessly. Apple TV also has built-in apps for Netflix, Hulu, YouTube, and a few other services if you're so inclined.  The $100 price tag is not bad considering the capability it gives you. There is nothing else like it available for mirroring iOS devices onto a TV. The main reason I debated was that I can already stream Amazon, YouTube, Netflix, and Hulu directly onto my TV without having to by a separate device (I have an LG smart TV).  But all of my music is in iTunes and there is no way to play it on the TV otherwise.  But the thing that really sold me was the iOS device mirroring.  Bottom line- I highly recommend it.

Reviews.Title: view to the cloud
Reviews.Author: Bill
Reviews.Content: I have always known the benefits and the simple beauty of design in Apple products, but because I work in the IT world, I've been tied to the anything-but-apple environment. Ironically, at home, it was my kids who convinced me to go Apple. We now have Iphones, Ipads, Ipods, Imacs ... and now the Apple TV.  Like all of those products named above, it is simple, well designed and full of features. As most of the reviewers have noted, if you are tied to the Apple world, the TV is an essential part. I also signed up for iMatch in which I have uploaded all of my CD's and "legalized (or matched) all of my Napster-downloaded songs (most of which I had in one media form or another anyway). iMatch is a beautiful solution to the problem of where to organize all of your media, and the Apple TV makes your TV a view to the cloud. I'm sold!

Reviews.Title: Best NetFlix watching device out there
Reviews.Author: Narto Gunawan "Felix Gunawan"
Reviews.Content: I use this to watch NetFlix and to stream music from it onto my TV.  It is very clean and light weight and you barely notice it since it's so small.  You can also use your iphone/ipad alongside Apple's "Remote" app to control the ATV from it.  Well done Apple.  Well done.

Reviews.Title: Solved my problems!
Reviews.Author: Needle
Reviews.Content: I have been working to solve a long standing problem I had of how to get all the digital content I own (music, photos, videos) from my computer to my main entertainment system.  I decided to try the AppleTV as a solution to this problem and not only has it solved my problem, it provides what I have found to be the best source for additional video content - both TV and Movies.  The iTunes library has what I have found to be the largest and most current source for the content I either rent or choose to buy.  I also recently subscribed to iTunes Match and simply turned on that feature on the AppleTV and I am now enjoying higher quality versions of all the songs I own!The product is quite small and puts itself in a sleep mode when not in use so it does not generate a lot of heat in my system or take up much room.  The quality of the picture and sound is HD and the user interface is similar to navigating through an iPod or iPhone.  Your content is easy to find and access and content for rent or sale is easy to browse.There are also several third party 'apps' that grant access to their content (like NBA.com or Netflix) but I have not used them as they usually carry their own subscription and the iTunes content is more to my liking.I have heard the potential that Apple will allow developers access to AppleTV to begin to create apps for this device as well - this would only enhance what has provien to be a great solution to my entertainment problem.

Reviews.Title: the best gets better
Reviews.Author: Nikwax
Reviews.Content: I've had all three generations of AppleTV (still have the first gen), and I'm impressed by the difference between the new AppleTV's 1080p and the previous 720p. Was it worth 99 bucks to upgrade? Absolutely.Apple TV allows us to do without cable/satellite at 120 bucks/month. We get to watch what we want, when we want it. And now it's 1080p.Wow.

Reviews.Title: Minor upgrade from previous version
Reviews.Author: AK529
Reviews.Content: After trying both versions of the apple tv 2 and 3. I can say if you don't really need 1080p then there's really no need to get the newer version. Only a few sources at this point are 1080p. The iTunes store is the main source where you will greatly benefit from the 1080p. There are quite a few tv shows and movies in 1080p in the iTunes store to rent or buy. If your buying this device for 1080p on Netflix then there still aren't that many movies or tv shows. Also it's very hard to find which ones are 1080p.  Unlike the iTunes store which has icons for HD which means 720p and other icons for 1080p. The Netflix app only has icons for standard definition and HD. From my experience Netflix streaming had very bad picture quality.  The picture seemed to be artifacted and pixelated even with HD content. I had no issues with same content on my apple tv 2 or any of my other netlix devices on my 32mbps connection. I'm guessing that my apple tv 3 was defective as I haven't heard complaints of my issues. There are many threads on macrumor forums and apple discussions forums about the same issue. From my experience the picture quality was only bad on Netflix. Regardless of my issues I still feel the apple tv 3 is not up to par with other streaming devices.  Just about any streaming device (gaming consoles, blu ray players and media boxes) offer many more options in terms of services). In addition alot of them are cheaper or at the same price of the apple tv3. The newer apple tv does has have a faster processor and more RAM than the previous version. The only way to get apps and more streaming services on your apple tv 3 is to use air play with either an iPad , iPhone or iPod touch. At this point there is no jailbreak available on the apple tv 3. I didn't notice a difference in performance on the newer apple tv 3. Also I personally didn't notice a difference in picture quality between my apple tv 2 and 3. If you already have an apple tv 2 then I don't think you need to upgrade to the newer one. Also if you are considering an apple tv at this time and don't have tv that is 46 inches or larger I would strongly recommend looking at getting a refurbished apple tv 2 for $69 directly from appple. I decided the return my apple tv 3 and just get the refurbished older model. It's cheaper, easier to jailbreak and still has the great features and interface.I still find the aplle tv 3 overpriced when compared to other streaming devices that it competes with. But for the air play functionality alone it makes a great accessory for the iPad , iPhone and iPod touch. Also the netlix interface is far suporior to any other device I've tried.

Reviews.Title: Ready for prime time with 1080p
Reviews.Author: Busy Executive
Reviews.Content: I added this to one of my older TVs so as to have a way to stream various types of content to it, whether from iTunes or one of the other sources. So far I'm impressed with the overall quality of what you can get through this tiny device.For one thing, 1080p content seems to be somewhat less compressed than other solutions I've seen. Given adequate bandwidth, and the same 1080p title looks better on the Apple TV than it does on some other services. Many people don't realize that 1080p alone isn't really a guarantee of any particular quality...just as important is the degree of compression applied to the video data. Broadcast quality 1080p often comes out of the camera at 60mb/sec. The best Blu-ray DVDs are about 40mb/sec...even top-end consumer video cameras are in the 24mb/sec range. Apple TV is 8mb/sec, but most of the competing products are maybe half this, meaning that while the Apple is tough on bandwidth, it gives you a better looking picture. To me, this alone is worth the price of the unit.Speaking of bandwidth, I find I just can't get adequate performance on wireless, so I've generally preferred to connect the Apple TV directly to my router with an Ethernet cable. A little less convenient, but overall much more stable. Of course, I use wireless from my computers to the Apple TV, but for online content, the wired approach gives me a much better experience (I have 35mbps Verizon FiOS).The other thing I love about the Apple TV is the included Airplay. My iPad2 not only streams music and videos, I can mirror my desktop to the Apple TV and project my iPad's desktop onto the big screen. As others mentioned, this feature is coming to Mac OS X in an upcoming release and will be a very handy way to display Mac content on the big screen. It seems to work quite well wirelessly, with just a slight delay.Overall, this little device is definitely worth the investment if you have adequate network capacity.

Reviews.Title: After a rough start, Apple TV is amazing!
Reviews.Author: Steve Z "Steve"
Reviews.Content: Got my Apple TV yesterday. Setup was a breeze. At first I absolutely loved everything about it, a step up from my Roku for sure. Then I used AirPlay to stream a few videos from my iPhone 5. The video was excellent but the audio was choppy (it was also very choppy when I streamed songs from my Windows 7 desktop running iTunes using Home Sharing). This was a deal breaker for sure. I spent a few hours tweaking my wireless router configuration (Actiontec wireless router for Verizon FiOS) with no improvement. I was about to pack up the Apple TV and send it back when I remembered that it had an optical audio output on the back. I connected the optical cable directly to my Onkyo receiver and voila! No more choppy audio. Seems the problem is with my Samsung HDTV panel and not the Apple TV (audio path was Apple TV -> HDMI -> Samsung HDTV -> optical cable -> Onkyo receiver). Now I can say without a doubt that the Apply TV absolutely ROCKS! Excellent video quality, excellent audio quality (now)... love Netflix streaming with this device too. Last night my wife and I used the AirPlay feature to stream a rented movie from our iPad 3 to the Apple TV... played perfectly and without any issues. Today I've been streaming Netflix, HBO GO, and even Amazon Prime videos (from my iPhone 5) without any issues. I've even used AirPlay on my MacBook Pro to display my desktop on the Apple TV. At this point I can safely say that I've put it through its paces (AirPlay via iPhone 5, iPad 3, MacBook Pro, and Netflix and HBO GO via internal apps, and iTunes streaming from iTunes Match (both music and radio) with excellent results. I'm 100% satisfied because it does everything so well and effortlessly.

Reviews.Title: Poor Netflix Video
Reviews.Author: c wildenauer
Reviews.Content: Poor Netflix Video quality. I can stream Netflix just fine on other devices, PS3, OPPO & Roku. I am happy with iOS and MBP and iTunes performance. I purchased this to replace older streaming devices, not functional.

Reviews.Title: Love this!
Reviews.Author: Diveartist
Reviews.Content: Very easy to install and use. I can stream from the Internet onto my HD TV right from my iPad by turning on mirroring. You need to go to the online manual to learn how to use all the features though. The set up guide that is printed is really just for the basic setup.

Reviews.Title: OK but I would recommend a roku over an apple tv
Reviews.Author: Jon Flaherty
Reviews.Content: I have both the Roku and the Apple TV.  I use the Roku 95% of the time.  I mostly use my Apple TV to stream music from my macbook pro and that's about it.  The Roku let's me watch all the netflix content, hbo go, etc.  It will also do the slideshow like the apple tv does.  I can also buy rentals through Amazon.com vs the Apple TV.  Amazon prices seem a bit lower too.

Reviews.Title: I can't quite recommend this at this point
Reviews.Author: Nicholas Moses
Reviews.Content: I'm a fan of many different Apple products, but I'm of the opinion that in recent years Apple has created one massively bad service (iTunes Match) and one not-so-functional product: the Apple TV 3.The 3rd Generation Apple TV should be great, and on first glance it appears to be. It can (under the right circumstances) play all your iTunes Match music, play Netflix/Vimeo/Hulu Plus/Youtube/iTunes videos, display your Photostream as a screensaver, and Airplay from your iPhone/iPad/iTunes PC/Mac.You'll notice that of the capabilities I listed above, many require some investment in the Apple infrastructure. I have that investment, with something like 8 Apple devices in my house from iPhones to a Mac Pro, and also have iCloud, iTunes Match, and a substantial iTunes library. Most of the function between Apple devices and the Apple TV works well. Unfortunately, the Apple TV's basic functions have serious issues.iTunes Match is the first major issue. I use both of them heavily. I already revealed my opinion of iTunes Match, which has been very difficult and problematic since I got it. If you set your Apple TV to stream iTunes Match music, it *will* freeze up every once in a while and stop playing until you tell it to start again. Very fast internet will not help you here, this is an Apple server problem. If you're running a PC or Mac with Homesharing enabled (and you should be) you can play your music from that, and it works like a charm. Of course, this requires you downloading the songs you want to hear ahead of time, which destroys the point of streaming.Photostream is a very cool feature that unfortunately doesn't seem to work properly for the majority of users. Google "photostream apple tv 3 issues." My Apple TV recognized 268 photos out of about 700 I keep on Photostream, and will not recognize the others, despite updates and system resets. Do not get Apple TV for the Photostream feature, because there's no guarantee it will work.Netflix and other video applications work very well on the Apple TV - it streams 1080p content without a hitch (provided of course you have decent internet). Unfortunately, there are some serious issues with the Apple Remote. It's a great looking and feeling little device, but is not completely functional. For example, to change Netflix audio settings and subtitles, the Apple TV tells you to "hold down the Select button." All that does is pause the video. In order to change these settings, you need to use the Remote App on your iPhone or iPad or iPod touch. Luckily that won't be a problem for most people, because so many households have one of those, but it's still an awfully annoying oversight. You can't watch Netflix videos with subtitles *unless* you use your other iOS device - and there are a number of similar, basic things you can't do without an iOS device.I'm keeping my Apple TV. I like what it does right - the interface, the aesthetics, and the functionality of iTunes Match (when it works), plus Airplay works well with my other devices. I could not recommend it to anyone who isn't willing to spend a few hours a month troubleshooting it. I really wish at this point that I had picked Google Music over iTunes Match, but since I didn't I'm willing to work with this sub-optimal device. If I wasn't reliant on iTunes I would switch to a Roku in a heartbeat, since they are vastly superior and easier to use in my experience.
