} } } Length:: 1:20 MinsI like this device for numerous reasons and I also own a Roku 2 XD streaming device. I got the Roku 2 first but like this device better for one reason. AirPlay, yep, that's it. AirPlay and mirroring are distinct advantages that no other player can offer. It is the one reason why this device is better than all of the other streamers on the market. The key is easy workarounds and enabling iPad Mirroring to get around any deficiencies in content.PROS*Small compact size, lightweight*1080P - Full HD, progressive scan*AirPlay - A distinct advantage over all other players - the killer app if you will*iTunes Library Available with iTunes Match*iCloud - Ties in beautifully with all other Apple devices*Netflix, Youtube, Hulu Plus, HBO GO - See my video review for all available channelsCONS*Price, more expensive than other units*AirPlay can be glitchy if someone else in your house is streaming*No HDMI cord provided in box*Limited content, no way to add additional content from the device but you can get around this by downloading Apps*Workarounds can be tricky to figure out, a lot easier nowadays with Google though, in all fairness*Not everything is AirPlay compatible or can be mirroredREVIEWAs stated above, my first experience was with the Roku 2 XD. It streams 1080P beautifully and has the big three, Netflix, Amazon and Hulu Plus. It also has tons of channels that you can add to it but no Youtube and no way to connect to the internet. Apple TV has Netflix and Hulu Plus but no Amazon. Probably because they don't like those Kindle tablets...however, there is a very easy workaround. If you download the Amazon Instant Video App to your iPad or iPhone it is AirPlay enabled meaning you can push the content right to your TV! This is a very easy workaround and the quality is very good.Next, we got this device to put the live Fios stations from their App to our TV so we didn't have to pay Verizon $15 bucks a month for a set top box. Well, the joke was on us because this App was not AirPlay enabled and would not allow any mirroring - in short, you are stuck watching this on your iPhone or iPad. This is just Fios wanting you to get another set top box...annoying, but is standard play in the content war game. Just like Apple TV not supporting Amazon....luckily Amazon is a good guy and built-in the workaround.The mirroring works great, can get glitchy at some times but if you keep other people off of the internet (not streaming) you will be fine.So we talked about the big three, iTunes & iCloud are nice features, the 1080P quality is there...and AirPlay and mirroring are distinct advantages over all of the other players on the market. You will need to download the CBS, ABC & FOX Apps, turn AirPlay on, lock the orientation of the screen and then open the App. For some reason you need to lock the orientation of the screen prior to starting the App or else the mirroring is sideways. NBC and Fios won't allow AirPlay or mirroring so you just need to play around with the stations and their Apps to see what is going to work for you. That is the workaround for live TV...works great if your network and your shows are on there....or you just get Hulu Plus...You can watch a bunch of stuff on Youtube as well and that seamlessly just pushes to the TV. So, the content is out there, you just have to do a little experimentation to see what will and will not work.Because you can get the big three plus AirPlay this device is the one to get. Chromecast doesn't have mirroring - so all of those ABC, CBS and FOX shows won't play.

Reviews.Title: good, but very limited
Reviews.Author: Doug Gold
Reviews.Content: I was able to get the apple TV setup pretty quick, it did have problems reading my Wifi network and I called apple and they had a fix within 5 minutes.  Once I got it going the features work pretty well, the netflix is great but does cost $8 month.  I have had issues with some of the airplay features where I have to reset the apple TV and/or my iPad 2/Iphone 4s.  The mirror function only works in SD and i wish it was expanded to HD.  If you just want to play music and videos from iTunes or Netflix this device is great! I wish it had more apps like HBO Go.

Reviews.Title: Fraud. This page should be removed.
Reviews.Author: John Faughnan "John G Faughnan"
Reviews.Content: This is a fraud praying on vulnerable consumers. A brand new Apple TV LISTS for $99, this is being sold for over $250.

Reviews.Title: Good Apple Product
Reviews.Author: Gregory R. Mccoy
Reviews.Content: I have both the Roku and the Apple TV. I have to say that I do like the Roku a little better, although, as everyone mentioned if you are already deep in the apple ecosystem, this is the way to go.

Reviews.Title: Excellent
Reviews.Author: fixXxer
Reviews.Content: When you buy something form apple what you get is qualityfrom packaging to performance everything is very good with Apple TVand every body knows about Apple TV so writing a review is pointless , However there are some issues that may be useful to some people1. you can not compare this to chrome cast , Roku , Amazon fire , Google TV and others the main difference is this is not only a smart tv it is a mirroring device that works perfectly with apple systems , you don't need to install anything on your iphone or computer to access it  and mirror everything very easy on your tv2.the only issue that this device has is when you mirroring your computer and you streaming a video like abc , cbs the result is not that perfectyou will get some freeze every 10 seconds , but this has a solution you have to use a high band wifi when you are doing thisThis means that with your old router you will only be able to mirror your phone , or play something from your computer (not streaming)(my router is now a 60mb n type router)I wish this worked with every other computers and phones , that's the only problem that This device has

Reviews.Title: Awesome AppleTV
Reviews.Author: ron tiller
Reviews.Content: I finally purchased the Apple TV. We love it! We got rid of my cable TV due the fact that we rarely watch shows when they actually aired. We DVRed every episode. We dropped cable and went with Netflix and Hulu Plus. We went through FPU and we are now saving lots of money by getting rid of our cable. Being able to access iTunes and also mirroring from my iPad and laptop are really great features. We Love our AppleTV and We would highly recommend to anyone!

Reviews.Title: Just buy one!
Reviews.Author: shoecrazy
Reviews.Content: Since buying Apple TV I have barely watched my cable! Netflix quality is awesome, and also HBOGO has more back-seasons than regular cable. Bring able to access iTunes and also airdrop from my iPad are really great features. Worth very penny and I would highly recommend to anyone.

Reviews.Title: This box is wrapped up by one word...AirPlay.
Reviews.Author: hornms
Reviews.Content: I have several ways of watching videos including SageTV, MCE, Roku, Ceton, and AppleTV.  I like the Netflix application on the Roku better than what is installed on the Apple TV (it automatically goes to the next show in the series).  HBO Go seems to be about the same.  But, neither device supports Cinemax Go so I have to stream that from my iPhone.  And that is where the Roku cannot compare to the Apple TV.  Airplay is a great service supported by the AppleTV that lets you stream video from your iPhone/iPad to your TV.  The quality is great.  I also use AirPlay to watch ShoAnytime.  The price is practically impulse buy, but the rumor is that Apple will release a newer, more powerful version soon that might include apps.

Reviews.Title: Love it!
Reviews.Author: Amazonaholik
Reviews.Content: Here's the scoop:My reason for buying: 1.  I've been trying to find a way to get rid of my cable bill but I'm not willing to say goodbye to certain tv shows. 2. I'm an "Apple" person. I have an iPhone and iPad and soon to have a Mac laptop. I chose Apple TV over the other gadget alternatives due to the fact I can "mirror" my other gadgets. The biggest reason for me is I downloaded all the tv network apps that my shows are on. I can watch my shows free through those apps (even the newest episodes if you watch within a week of them first airing). It has tons of other perks too! HBO! All the shows and movies free and on your own time. Lots of other apps for shows and movies and music (including sports) You can bring up all your photos etc..... Literally anything u can do with your other Apple gadgets (Aside from making phone calls I assume).What you need to know:an HDMI cable is not included so you need to buy one if you don't have an extra. They're only a few dollars on amazon. If u don't have wireless internet you'll also need an Ethernet cable. And optional is an audio optical cable if u want it. But I don't need it apparently becaus mine is working perfectly without it.Lastly, I had issues figuring out how to enable "home sharing" and "airplay mirror". You have to turn on home sharing from a Mac or PC through iTunes. It can't be done from iPad, iPhone or Apple TV. I just downloaded iTunes for my PC and turned it on though there. For turning on "mirror" you go to the home screen of your iPhone or iPad and swipe up from the bottom. When the menu slides up click "airplay" and "Apple TV" and switch to "yes" and it'll pop up on your tv screen (when you have your Apple TV screen on).I highly recommend it to do away with a high cable bill. Nowadays you can watch your shows free through apps and since this allows you to bring them up on your tv it's perfect. And watch it when you want without paying for DVR service. I hear amazon fire is pretty cool and I don't doubt it one bit. But if you have Apple products already I say this is a must to link them all together.

Reviews.Title: THE BEST of it's kind, bar none. Don't hesitate, buy this!
Reviews.Author: J. Johnson
Reviews.Content: This Apple TV has everything you every wanted. And why is it better than the Amazon Fire TV, and better than the Roku? The reason is because it offers something that NO OTHER DEVICE OFFERS: Accessibility services for the blind. APPLE TV can be set to talk to you, everything that is on the screen! Blind people, millions and millions of blind people can use this Apple TV perfectly! It's an amazing product.The Amazon Fire TV and ROKU devices is completely crap and doesn't allow anyone with disabilities to use their product. SHAME ON THEM.BUY THE APPLE TV, support Blind people world-wide and get the best TV unit ever invented. No kidding.

Reviews.Title: reduce cable bill
Reviews.Author: JD
Reviews.Content: We purchased this Apple TV to take advantage of airplay from the iPad.  We put the basic Roku in a guest room that isn't used very often in order to avoid monthly cable equipment cost.  We have not gotten to the point of completely cutting the cord since there are still a few cable channels we enjoy, plus we like to get our local news and weather.  Although the overall content available on Apple TV pales in comparison to Roku, airplay helps to make up for it since you can stream Amazon, Pandora and others from your iPad through Apple TV onto your HDTV.  Plus Apple TV contains YouTube which is currently only available on the Roku 3 model, although supposedly that may change in the near future.  If you are a Comcast customer, they allow HBO Go to be activated on Apple TV but not through Roku.  Neither device is better than the other, both have their own advantages and disadvantages.  But if you are hesitant to cut the cord, with either one of these devices you may be able to subscribe to a smaller cable package and save money.

Reviews.Title: Cheaper than apple.com
Reviews.Author: HT
Reviews.Content: I think by this point if you wanted an apple tv, you would have gotten it. If you don't know what an apple tv is, well, plenty of reviews by professionals will answer all your questions. So here is what you're getting from, why should you buy it from amazon.com rather than, say, apple store1. listing price is cheaper2. maybe you still live in one of those great states that there is no sales tax when purchasing from amazonoverall, you save about 10-20 bucks.No HDMI cable -- while you're at it, pick one up from amazon for like 3 bucks. DO NOT go to your local bestbuy or radioshock to buy an HDMI cable, they will charge you 10x the amount.

Reviews.Title: Works great
Reviews.Author: Chris Hall
Reviews.Content: I am actually more impressed with this Apple TV then I thought I would be. Very smooth graphics. Loading times are great. Very suprised. Could not be happier.

Reviews.Title: APPLE TV
Reviews.Author: j
Reviews.Content: Posted by an APPLE NUT .... After having this for a while now it turns out to be far too limited in what it can do and why is ITUNES SOOOOO SLOW ...  I think I would try a ROKU next... I would not buy another..

Reviews.Title: Roku for most people; though Apple TV is definitely superior to ChromeCast and preferable to Roku for some of us.
Reviews.Author: Samuel Chell
Reviews.Content: Roku was and still is the most dependable, consistent, foolproof set-up with the most channels. For only fifty bucks, I don't see how you can beat it as the "first" choice for people seeking alternatives to cable, over-the-air programming, and DVD players.  In fact, both of my children's families have dropped cable and moved exclusively to Roku plus Netflix and Amazon for all of their needs.  My wife prefers cable and uses Roku for an occasional Netflix stream.That leaves me as the Apple TV guy, and this is the 2nd one I've purchased of Apple's 3 editions.  The box can be more temperamental than Roku, requiring the right settings on your computer and mobile devices, as well some limited knowledge about the device's interaction with iCloud and your various media libraries (iTunes will increase its usefulness)..  Also, the buyer should first be made aware that, unlike Roku, Apple TV does not give the user access to Amazon Prime services and features. Finally, for some reason each time I'm finished using Apple TV, I simply can't produce the necessary blinking "start-up" light the next time I use it unless I first go to the floor, unplug the device, wait a few seconds, then replug.  (It's probably good exercise for me, but some of us can be obsessive about ensuring that consumer media technology functions as flawlessly as its claims)  This 3rd generation Apple TV is far more reliable than my previous generation model, which eventually wouldn't even let me select "Settings," but I was disappointed at the discovery that it would still require unplugging the device from AC before each use (maybe my "unsmart" TV is at fault).Unlike some, I don't require Apple TV simply to be able to hear my collection of music or to see my photos and movies in a room where there's a paired, compatible television set.  But I do find that the combination of the ITunes Store, with its vast holdings and resources, plus the availability of YouTube (not available on my Roku box), make up for the absence of Amazon content.  Moreover, I'm amazed at the effectiveness of "Air Play", which enables the user to "mirror" movies and videos on an iPod, iPad, or iPhone on a large TV screen--and in detail that's strikingly sharp.  (I would watch music videos streamed from Youtube all day long if it were my choice.)  One caveat: not all features are available to users who don't have Apple mobile devices or a computer with the iTunes program on it. Also, although I can "mirror" my computer's desktop onto my television set, the image is so dull I'm not inclined to use this feature.As for ChromeCast, it's far more limited in program content than either Roku or Apple TV and is, imo, fully valued, even at its current low price.  The ChromeCast device itself (which is nothing more than an extra-large thumb drive) was resistant to a secure HDMI connection in the back of my TV, and its attached short cord that must be plugged into a nearby USB port is a nuisance disproportionate to the reward.The best I can say for ChromeCast, when comparing it to the other two, is that it doesn't require a remote control (which is constantly getting lost).  I keep ChromeCast only for emergency use--should either of the other two boxes fail to access Netflix or "throw" a Youtube video on to my TV screen (which I rarely have time to watch--figuring out these gadgets takes up too much of it).  Some owners claim that Chromecast is the best of the three for "multitasking."  Regardless, I'm happy to leave such activities to those who are more versatile than I.  Moreover, the device works best with computers that have Google's Chrome browser installed, and by habit I simply can't use anything other than Apple's Safari browser.

Reviews.Title: Not perfect, but better than nothing
Reviews.Author: D. Nick "Eppur Si Muove"
Reviews.Content: I use this for sharing airplay across a few of my devices and for that alone, this product is worth it. The only thing I hate about it, is the apps to access channels like Disney, ABC, ESPN, etc. You need a cable provider (they don't like satellite companies for some reason) in order to access them. That part is misleading, and no where in any of the documentation either with apple, or here on Amazon, provide that to you. Quite honestly, I would appreciate getting access to my NFL.com, or MLB.com accounts in Apple TV but I can always hope.

Reviews.Title: What took me so long?
Reviews.Author: Diane A. "dusty dog"
Reviews.Content: I was getting really sick of cable TV's exorbitant costs for channels that I will never watch in a million years.  So, I decided to cut the cable, so to speak, keep my internet connection, and opt for a pay-as-I-go media model.  Using Amazon Prime videos, primarily, and purchasing some shows that I want to watch, this has been great.  I'm saving big bucks and getting the programming I choose.It's a piece of cake to set up, and watching on my HDTV instead of my iMac is so much better.  I've read that if you already have Apple products in your home, this is the way to go, over Roku or other brands.  I don't know.  But, this works seamlessly.  The sound, the video, everything is better.  I highly recommend ditching cable TV.  It's old, gasping technology that will soon go by the wayside, as their greed will put them out of business.  Gotta love market forces.

Reviews.Title: Not worth it
Reviews.Author: Carlos C.
Reviews.Content: So far I've had nothing but problems with Apple TV. Bad streaming or no streaming at all. These last few days the movies or shows I want to watch on HBO GO I'm not able to watch because of their server problems. This has been going off and on since I bought this a couple of months ago.When it finally does work, it's fine. Was it worth it for me to purchase? No. I'm wondering if anyone else has been having this problem?

Reviews.Title: Love this apple
Reviews.Author: LocalBoy
Reviews.Content: Installation was very easy.  Plugged it into my tv hdmi port. Powered it up and up it came once I changed the input to the hdmi port.One thing I wish they would do for this is to allow a wireless keyboard interface or a smart phone keyboard interface.  It is slow to do a search and input the name/title/etc using the scroll and click method. I guess if you do it often enough it will get easier or faster.

Reviews.Title: Must have product

Reviews.Content: This product is amazing! you can rent movies, listen to music, watch photos and movies from your iPhone, iPad, Mac, and PC directly in your TV! I'm very happy with this Apple TV. You can even mirror your Mac computer in the TV without any cables

Reviews.Title: Awesome!
Reviews.Author: Anthony B.
Reviews.Content: This is an awesome piece if you have apple products. I purchased this so my daughter could play her learning games on our ipad through our TV. It works wonders when they are trying to learn there ABC's etc. I also use this for netflix and hulu even though i have a smart tv the apple apps seem to work better and stream at a better quality. I would highly recommend this to anyone with kids or those who have apple products.

Reviews.Title: It's great
Reviews.Author: Jennifer Cagide
Reviews.Content: Adding Apple TV to our own changed everything the same way adding a TIVO back in the day did.  I love having my movies and tv shoes at my finger tips. I have a child and having his movies all there without having to fumble with finding, keeping track of, or changing DVDs is really great

Reviews.Title: Great iPad Companion - with Roku 3 comparison Plus can you play iPad instruments over Airplay?
Reviews.Author: Steve Conslaw
Reviews.Content: The Apple TV MD199LL/A has two basic functions. It's an audio/video streaming device like the Roku and it's a wireless connection device between your iPad and your television - that's the "Airplay" feature.  My family has both the most recent Roku and the Apple TV. The Roku and the Apple TV have more similarities than differences. Both are compact, easy to set up, compact, have a simple menu navigation system and provide excellent streaming. Not surprisingly, the Apple TV features iTunes store rentals and purchase of music and movies and Apple Radio. The Roku doesn't have Apple Store but basically has all the competitors, Vudu, Amazon, etc.  As a device for streaming movies, I'd give the nod to the Roku.  The ace up Apple's sleeve though is the iPad connectivity. With Airplay turned on I can play whatever is on my iPad (iPad 3 in my case) on my television (projector in my case) through the Apple TV. This makes the Apple TV the perfect accessory for a home theater system. Instead of playing my ipad through it's on board speaker or headphones, I can play it through the home theater system speakers while I carry it rather than have it tied to the charging stand.  I stream a lot of Pandora, Sirius/XM and Youtube music videos. Lately I've been getting into Apple Radio also.  The audio and video quality of Airplay streamed content is great. There is some lag (latency) that makes airplay connections unsuitable for most games.  By the way, I tried playing software instruments on the iPad through using the Airplay audio. As I expected, there was too much latency, at least a full second between when I hit the notes and when the sound arrived. I didn't notice the same latency playing movies. The iPad must compensate on streamed video feeds.  I think it would be great if Apple came out with an Audio-only over airplay mode which would allow a huge reduction in latency.  We'll see if it happens.  I'm giving the Apple TV five stars, because for under $100.00, it's a very useful little box. If you have an iPad and a home theater receiver, the Apple TV will increase your enjoyment of both.

Reviews.Title: Love my Apple TV
Reviews.Author: J. Harley
Reviews.Content: I own both an Apple TV and a Roku 3.  I originally bought the Apple TV but quickly found myself wanting more channels.  As a primarily Apple user, I didn't want to replace the Apple TV because I love the airplay mirroring and streaming from my Mac or iOS devices.  The Apple TV is very fast and responsive, especially compared to the online apps in my Internet capable TV.  So far, I have not encountered any buffering or sync issues with the apple TV.  I originally had it connected with an ethernet cable but after purchasing the Roku, I now run it wireless in the family room.  I keep the Apple TV in the family room so other family members can mirror or stream from their iOS devices.As I mentioned, my only complaint with Apple TV is a lack of channels. The only premium channel available is HBO Go.  However, the only extra premium offered on Roku is Epix.  Also, some of the extra channels are pretty worthless, like SyFy.  Forget full episodes of current and former SyFy faves like Being Human, Helix or Battlestar Galactica.  The SyFy channel on Roku offers nothing more than snippets.  Dozens and dozens of minutes long snippets.  Uh, no thanks.  Apple TV does offer several news, weather, specialty and children's channels (like Disney).  There is no Amazon instant video as offered on Roku.  Movies and television shows that aren't available on any other channels must be purchased through iTunes.  The included remote is small and limited to basic playback functions or text entry using the directional arrows.  A remote app is available for free from iTunes that gives you more flexibility and is much more efficient for certain tasks, especially text entry.  The keyboard in the iOS remote app will make you never again want to use the directional arrows on the bundled remote.  All remotes work through the network, not bluetooth or infrared.  I can actually control the Apple TV in the family room from any other room.  Last week, I was able to display photos from my iPhone two rooms away.  In addition to the iPhone, the app works on iPods and iPads as well.So far, I've had my Apple TV since the end of November.  As of mid-January I have not experienced any major issues with A/V sync or buffering.  It worked flawlessly when I originally had it connected via an ethernet cable.  Once I switched to wifi, I still never encountered any sync issues, however, I'll occasionally get a very quick buffering.  It is infrequent and  doesn't last more than a second or two.  I actually get more buffering delays when watching streaming video wirelessly on much more powerful laptops.If you're trying to decide between Apple TV and Roku, I suggest Roku if you're really into watching online content and want the greatest variety of channels available.  Apple TV currently can't come close to the number of channels offered by Roku.  If you own a Mac or iOS devices and get your content primarily from iTunes or plan to do a lot of streaming /mirroring from your Apple device, Apple TV is a no-brainer.  I actually fall into both categories, so I own both.  With recent sale prices, they were still pretty affordable.

Reviews.Title: Awesome
Reviews.Author: M. Brown
Reviews.Content: I tried this and the Roku. I found that the the Roku had WAY more channels (apps), but in the end, I opted for the Apple TV since I probably wouldn't even watch 1/16 of the media available on the Roku. The AirPlay functionality really sold me, as I am able to stream my Xfinity online media to my TV, as well as all the media that is not on the Apple TV yet. So who cares if I don't get the Korean News channel or the vintage horror movie channel...Between Hulu, Netflix, HBO, PBS, ABC, and the AirPlay option, I'm all set.The device itself is true Apple...High quality, great UI (Way better than Roku), easy to  use, and the remote is small, functional and works well from a distance. If you own a Mac, the remote also doubles as a remote for the computer as well.Great functionality with iTunes and Home sharing, as well. I am able to play my entire iTunes library through the Apple TV, which then goes through my sound bar.I love it! Keep those updates coming, Apple!

Reviews.Title: AppleTV a must for any Apple Home
Reviews.Author: R.N.
Reviews.Content: If you have an iTunes account and some other Apple products in your home, this item is almost a necessity.Setup is very simple, plug in the power cord and connect an HDMI cable to the TV. Viola! Done! The operating system on the AppleTV is intuitive and simple to navigate. It ties directly into your home network and your iTunes account. Anything you have purchased via iTunes can be accessed on the AppleTV.Additionally, if you have an Apple iPad, iPhone or Computer, you can utilize the Mirroring or AirPlay functionality of the AppleTV. Mirroring allows you to share the screen of your device on your TV. For example, you should display the screen of your iPad on the TV screen. So if you were showing photos to family of a recent trip, you could show them on the TV rather than people needing to gather around your computer or iPad. Keep in mind that Mirroring and Airplay on works with Apple devices.The AppleTV also has various Apps built into it. You can access your Netflix account, HBO GO, and other items from Sporting Leagues like the MLB.As a bit of a caveat. If connecting multiple AppleTV devices in your house or if you happen to have other iPad/iPhone devises in your house, be cautious of what you're streaming and sending to an AppleTV. I recently heard of a story where a young man was watching some rather "adult" oriented material and didn't realize he was streaming the sound to the AppleTV in his parents TV room. Made for a rather interesting Christmas.

Reviews.Title: it works but.....
Reviews.Author: M. Duggan
Reviews.Content: I gave 4 of these for christmas presents this year and everyone returned them and got a Chromecast.  The reason was because they couldn't use Amazon Prime with them easily.  There are ways to watch Prime through the Apple TV but its a hassle and no one wants to jump through hoops to watch a movie.  If you don't have Amazon Prime it works great.

Reviews.Title: Apple TV MD199LL/A
Reviews.Author: sacpaw
Reviews.Content: I love how I can mirrow my iPad and iPhone and watch videos from my iPhone and even though Apple TV does not have Amazon Video I can still access the movie or TV show I want to watch from my Amazon Prime Instant Video app on my iPad or iPhone and use Air Play to watch it through my Apple TV.

Reviews.Title: Apple junkies shouldn't live without
Reviews.Author: cocktailconcoctor
Reviews.Content: First I must admit that I support apple products fully and because I do my products work together better than most. We have 3 Mac computers, an apple extreme, 2 iPods, iPads and only iPhones, there is no droid products and the only Microsoft product is loaded on a Mac computer. This Apple TV works flawlessly with the other products and streams more beautifully than our hd cable does. There are limitations though. We purchase music and video from amazon as well as having a prime membership that forces us to watch prime video through another resource (ps3) while we were once able to stream through airplay there have been limitations created that unable both audio and video to seamlessly stream in unison. There has been additions made to the channels that are very helpful. HBO and espn to go are great additions that expand viewing options exponentially and also alleviate DVR needs for me. I would give 5 stars if amazon purchased products worked just as iTunes products do, but unfortunately they do not.

Reviews.Title: It just works
Reviews.Author: D. L. Beard
Reviews.Content: I like how the appleTV just works.  The channels are abundant with a new PBS app and Smithsonian Channel app as well as the regular Netflix and Hulu apps and more.TIP:  If you click and hold on an app, it will select it, and not open it, and allow you to then relocate it with the arrow buttons.  This can help to stick apps you don't use at the bottom and bring ones you love up to the top for easy accessibility.

Reviews.Title: Go with the Roku
Reviews.Author: kazper
Reviews.Content: Very limited apps for this. We have a Roku and were given this as a present. Honestly, I would have taken it back to the store and bought another Roku if that was an option.It works well for Netflix and I assume pay per view movies, but doesn't offer a service for Amazon prime or various other channels. Seems to be severely limited in its capabilities, yet more expensive. Maybe if I had more Apple products, this device would better suit my needs.

Reviews.Title: Apple TV
Reviews.Author: beachcripple
Reviews.Content: I have one in my living room and bedroom. Love how well it streams my media. Zero bad things to say about this.

Reviews.Title: Perfect for my needs
Reviews.Author: Sylvia
Reviews.Content: Good price.  Mirrors my Mac laptop easily. Got my mom hooked on Netflix.  What else could you want?  THe built-in Menu doesn't offer Amazon streaming, but the easy mirroring compensates for that.

Reviews.Title: Won't stream super HD right now. Apple Please fix!
Reviews.Author: JJ
Reviews.Content: I can't get super HD with Netflix or Vimeo... I have a Sony Blu-ray Player with Wifi and the quality is noticeably better. As much as I really really want to use the Apple, cause it's my new toy, I can't stand the inferior picture quality... The interface is nice... The remote is cool (I think it's drilled out of a solid piece of aluminum)  It's small and yatta yatta.... The mirroring is a bit slow.... maybe it's my router though? I do have 802n however...  I dunno.... I'd be so much happier if the friggin thing streamed HD. I'm so surprised Apple put out such a piece of crap.  I do have faith that they'll fix it some day...  People notice and aren't happy [...]

Reviews.Title: Very good if you have iOS devices
Reviews.Author: Jeremy S
Reviews.Content: As a bit of background, there are 4 iPads, 2 iPhones, 2 iPod Touches, and a Mac Mini in my house. Because of all the iOS devices around my house and because all my media is already in iTunes on the Mac Mini. Anyway, because of all this, I made the decision to purchase the Apple TV instead of a Roku that I was looking at and so far I am very pleased. The apple TV connects easily to my itunes library and plays all of my movies and music. Using Airplay to stream music and videos off of my assorted ios devices is very nice also. Netflix and Hulu both work well on the Apple TV and there are many other "Channels" such as sports, and childrens programming that will appeal to others.In summary, if you already have your media in itunes or have ios devices this is a very good choice for a streaming device.

Reviews.Title: Little Black Box
Reviews.Author: M. Olson "zeusofolympus"
Reviews.Content: The hardware is elegant and it was easy to setup. The initial update took some time but I was streaming from my iTunes library and Hulu in no time. Picture quality is great. The remote is simplistic and the menus are easy to navigate.Update: I have been using my iPhone with the Apple tv's airplay ability to stream video and music from my phone and it works great.

Reviews.Title: Cut your cable cord!
Reviews.Author: Denver37
Reviews.Content: It makes every TV a SMART TV and it is helping me to cut the cable cord.  I will not miss paying Comcast the cost of this unit every month.  It works so well I bought a second one for the bedroom. Now if it only worked with Prime.  Good thing my Panasonic TV does that already.

Reviews.Title: This might be the 21TH century's greatest invention,really fun, and incredibly easy to use from great grandpa to the baby's use.
Reviews.Author: GoodVibrations
Reviews.Content: The AppleTV always impresses me. It's amazing how you can watch something on your computer A button and then watch it on the television the children love it.

Reviews.Title: Great engine for your TV.
Reviews.Author: T. Parry "World Traveler"
Reviews.Content: Great way to access a ton of content... It's super cheap, and you have easy access to Netflix, Youtube, and other content that you can rent or buy from Apple.  It's a no brainer, and also a good step in the effort to get rid of cable.

Reviews.Title: Must have addition
Reviews.Author: Jeff
Reviews.Content: Can't believe I didn't one of these sooner. Great upgrade and plenty of apps. The airplay function from my Iphone puts everything else I need on the big screen.

Reviews.Title: Awesome!
Reviews.Author: Larry "Larry"
Reviews.Content: This is just awesome! We have Roku and this is the perfect addition for more TV options. This also offers a lot of other options besides just watching movies. You can turn your TV into a huge digital photo slide show, or listen to yout iTunes library. A perfect addition to any entertainment center.

Reviews.Title: My two favorite features...
Reviews.Author: Paul From Boulder "pfb"
Reviews.Content: Great TV accessory for $95... My two favorite features: 1. With OSX 10.9 (Maverick) you can set up your big screen as a wireless second display. 2. If you subscribe to HBO through your cable/satellite provider, you can access a huge library of HBO movies and series through the Apple TV.

Reviews.Title: Awsome Apple Tv
Reviews.Author: Randall Scott Brown
Reviews.Content: Apple Tv is awsome you are able to watch netflex right off of it . You can access your itunes account off of it . you can stream any songs or videos or pictures off of your other Apple products off of this Apple Tv. I would reccomend this product to anyone that  has quite a few Apple products.

Reviews.Title: How did I go this long without this?
Reviews.Author: Allison "The Book Wheel"
Reviews.Content: How have I gone this long without Apple TV? It's so wonderful. We have one for the spare bedroom/library and it's great for Netflix and Hulu. PLUS, I absolutely adore the whole remote-on-the-phone feature. It's also really easy to set up so if I want to switch rooms I can easily move the device. To be honest, I'll probably end up buying myself a second and another as a gift for my parents.

Reviews.Title: A major addition to your "wired" home.
Reviews.Author: R. Rasmussen
Reviews.Content: There are so many great features, I'll try to highlight the ones that are most important:When plugged into the HDMI port of your television, you will have to switch the input to HDMI. Once that is done the startup screen will show up. It will want to link to your home wi-fi network so choose that network and use the enclosed Apple TV Remote to enter the password for the network (if you have a password on your network-if you don't, you REALLY should).APPLE MAGIC: Once you have linked the Apple TV to your Wi-Fi network, and if you have a newer version of your iPhone or iPad, make sure that this device (iPad or iPhone) has Bluetooth enabled (check Settings)  and is on the same network as your Apple TV. Then tap (yes, physically tap) the iPhone or iPad on the Apple TV (just a tap, you're not trying to break it) and the iPhone or iPad will link to the Apple TV which will make setup very very easy because you will be able to use the keyboard on your iDevice rather than the Apple TV Remote. BE ADVISED: this doesn't always work so if it doesn't you will have to complete the setup using the Apple TV Remote. If you have an under 25 child in the house who texts regularly, let them use the Apple TV remote to finish the rest of setup; it's so much easier for them!).Once you have the setup completed, use the Apple TV Remote to select options for you.EASIER: If you have a later iPhone or iPad, go to the App Store and download Remote (it's free). This will allow you to link with your Apple TV and not use the Apple TV Remote, which is a good thing.What fun things can it do?If you have a later model iPhone or iPad, you can project the image on your device directly on your television.If you have iOS 6; Click your home button twice and then slide the apps button to the right until you see a small square with a filled triangle on the bottom half. This is the AirPlay button. Tap it and choose the Apple TV as the source. Then slide the "Mirroring" slider to the on position. Within a few seconds your device's screen will show up on your television screen.If you have iOS 7: Slide the controls panel up from the bottom of your home screen. The AirPlay button is labeled. Tap it and choose the Apple TV as the source. Then slide the "Mirroring" slider to the on position. Within a few seconds your device's screen will show up on your television screen.You can watch Netflix, YouTube, Sports, you can stream any media that you have purchased from Apple including Music, TV, Movies, etc.You will find that the Apple TV is a welcome addition to your technology. Even if it's the only Apple device you have.

Reviews.Title: Dependable Apple product
Reviews.Author: smwknits
Reviews.Content: I bought this to use with my flat screen television, to watch Netflix primarily. And to mirror my iPad on a larger monitor. It works fine for both. It was quite easy to set up, and using the remote is pretty intuitive. I didn't need any directions.

Reviews.Title: A must have for Apple Users
Reviews.Author: Sean L
Reviews.Content: If you don't have one, get one. I have an iPhone, iPod touch, Mac Book Pro, and an iPad. So naturally I had to get an Apple TV. By far one of my best investments. You can literally throw a video, picture, or song onto the big screen from any of your other devices. It's great when friends and family are over to be able to do so.

Reviews.Title: Fantastic and easy to use
Reviews.Author: P. Chen
Reviews.Content: We got rid of cable because of this fantastic little device. Between various download services and the relatively easy time we had finding a program to convert files to Apple format, we can stream almost anything to our tv except for live material. The integrated services work really easily and the quality is flawless without buffering. Wifi connection was a simple password and apple found our non-apple based network without a blip. My only complaint is that the quite stylish remote, while solid, is not ergonomically easy to use if you have big fingers. It's hard telling where the guide "bumps" on the circle are compared to the button part in the center.

Reviews.Title: Stopped working!
Reviews.Author: Andres Garcia
Reviews.Content: I like it very much, sadly after 4 months it stopped working, apparently I bought one of the bad ones, apple says they are gonna change it, I hope so!

Reviews.Title: Just Awesome. Well Worth It.
Reviews.Author: SirK
Reviews.Content: The Apple TV is the best companion device for your iOS devices and iTunes. Even if the AirPlay Mirroring is the only feature you ever use, it would have been well worth it.I have completely replace my cable provider with Netflix, Hulu Plus, and iTunes. This is one of the best purchases I have ever made, and the 1080p video quality is just awesome.To anyone who is already invested in the iTunes ecosystem, I would highly recommend getting an Apple TV to compliment your visual experience. You won't regret it.

Reviews.Title: Awesome!!!
Reviews.Author: Mauricio
Reviews.Content: I am a big fan of Apple TV.It's an amazing device for anyone who loves high quality video content.You can absolutely choose whatever you want to watch, anytime you want to watch it.Say good by to your cable tv providers and get ready to build your own tv programming.Choosing from great movies to tv shows.And for those of you who live in Brazil, there is anything like this!!!Stop depending on Net, TVA, SKY, with their lame programming.In addition, the airplay is awesome. You are able to stream anything to your tv or receiver from your apple devices.It's a must have!!!

Reviews.Title: Yeehaw!!!
Reviews.Author: Marc
Reviews.Content: I got this to mirror my iPad on an hdtv.  Wow!  Really impressed.  I did have to reboot my iPad in order for the airplay icon to appear but no problems afterwards.  Sure there's a lot of fee based content here but since I cut cable years ago I wanted to be able to stream stuff off all my apple devices and home computer onto the TV.  Easy peasy.Now if we can only get Amazon Instant Videos app to become airplay compliant.........

Reviews.Title: Looking for a small device to use as a Netflix box...
Reviews.Author: Andi H. "Andi"
Reviews.Content: Works great. I wish it had more apps for watching other online content. Not necessarily games and such, but apps that would allow access to video content from popular websites something like the Roku or XBMC plugins. I actually was about to buy the Roku but then found out that it's Netflix app does not work here in South America, so I went with the Apple TV although I do not own any other Apple devices... and I have to say that it works very well within it's limitations.

Reviews.Title: Still a hobby
Reviews.Author: John Kenderdine "physical sciences teacher"
Reviews.Content: At less than a hundred bucks, I decided to push the buy button after thinking about it for a couple of generational iterations. I watch a lot of TV, but seldom sports programming. I don't often rent a movie and certainly don't buy or collect DVDs, don't go to the theater often. So why do I even need this? I don't. The Apple TV is a Wi-Fi connected gateway to other web portals like Netflix, Hulu Plus, Go HBO, and Apple store most of which seem to require rental fees or paid subscriptions to get content. So beyond the hundred bucks you pay for this Wi-Fi peripheral you have to really want the content to pay extra to these providers in addition to already having working, Wi-Fi and cable or other internet connection services (which are utility subscriptions as well). Can you tell I am not a fan of the subscription payment model? Anyway, Apple TV will allow me to stream iTunes music content from my 2007 model iMac to my music system on a different floor of my home. The iMac has to be awake and iTunes running, however. Also useful, I can mirror my iPad 2 (won't work with the iPad1) and control Apple TV from it using Apple Remote app, and some apps and web sites can access Apple TV directly from the iPad. I can also display anything in my photo library on the iMac or iPad on the HDTV screen and associated surround sound system. Video and display mirroring from the iMac is limited to models 2011 and newer, very sad, but I knew that going in. I found it desirable to bump my cable internet speed from 1.5 Mbs (that's bits not bytes, by the way) to 5 Mbs another $5/mo, since some trailers and other content took a long time to load. This helped, but I think I would need even faster and more costly speed for some streaming HD content to be viewed without breaks. There is a lot of nickle and dime (read $5 and $10) added costs to getting the most out of this device. That sticks in the craw of this thrifty but honest reviewer.

Reviews.Title: First Impressions - Needs more Content but Great for Up to Date Apple Users
Reviews.Author: Tristan Tighe
Reviews.Content: About me, I'm a tech guy with 30 years experience. Over the past 2 years I have heavily invested in the Apple Eco System. I have IPods, an iPad 2, a 2012 Mac Mini, and now Apple TV (newest version). It's been well stated that there is not a lot available for content outside of the Apple Eco System as compared to Roku, for example.I've hardwired the ethernet connection to my router from the Apple TV, as suggested, to avoid overloading my wireless capability at home.I'm running the latest version of the OS on the Apple TV, Mirroring my Mountain Lion and Ipad screens is very handy.I've updated my review and added a 4th star because the 'wired ethernet causing content load failure' issue has been addressed. The device needs to have more content available and have it available from the Itunes store. That's the only drawback at this point that I see, and it costs 1 star...I have seen one 'bug' in the current version of the software. Loading select Vimeo content caused an error message stating that the content wouldn't load because my TV didn't support the 'HDMC' protocol (an encryption protocol used by newer HDMI devices). Recommended fix was replugging my Apple TV into the TV. That didn't work. Cold booting the Apple TV did fix the issue.As others have stated, this is a no brainer if you already have Apple products, especially newer ones. If you don't have Apple products, then unfortunately at this time, I could not recommend this product to you, it simply wouldn't have the value per the cost to you... That's the bottom line.

Reviews.Title: I love it, but I had problems with it freezing... (solved)
Reviews.Author: Ludlum
Reviews.Content: Now that I've gotten it to work, I love it as much as I love all my iPhone.  The only thing was when I first got it, it would always freeze or stop working after about 10 minutes.  I drove myself INSANE trying to find a solution.  I was so upset about it!So the solution, if you're like me is that you have to go to your router in any internet broswer by typing in the ip address, log in, and add in the atv's ip address as always allowed.  I don't trully understand why this is, but the explanation is something about devices are constantly "reconnecting" to the router, and this is what disrupts the atv's performance and ruins everything until fixed.  They say modern routers don't do this, but mine is only a few months old, so I think it's a problem with atv that it doesn't work out of the box or at least make it easier to find this solution which it took me HOURS to find.  I hope if you have this problem you find this review sooner.

Reviews.Title: Great (but really 4.6 stars)
Reviews.Author: Grizelda "grizzy"
Reviews.Content: was torn between 4 and 5 stars because:Easily 5 stars in terms of how much I enjoy owning/using, but4 stars because there are things I'd like to change without having to jailbreak.PROS:A) Instantaneous streaming (assuming you have a fast network)from: a) your computer* b) media purchased or rented from iTunes Store. c) Music in iMatch (puts music from non-iTunes store music in the cloud) but costs $25 d) photos from iPhoto (MacOnly) or PhotoStreamBy far the fastest most capable wireless or LAN based system I've tried for streaming from your computer  -- Love it or hate it: what makes the system work so well is that iTunes does all the heavy lifting rather than the device, (or incomprehensibly slow Windows Media Player - perhaps this will improve with new xBox). So your passion for this device assumes you like/love and/or can at least tolerate iTunes*.A1) Can play visitors music and videos: I assume this only true if they're running iOS devices. Keep forgetting to try with Android bearing guests, but sincerely doubt it would work without special software.B)Truly brain-dead set up (if you bother reading 3 pages of included manual) download it if you lost it.C)Free stuff: Watch/listen to Podcasts, play YouTube, Vimeo, Movie Trailers, Flickr, digital Radio Stations etc. As well as standard paid services (Netflix, Hulu Plus, MLB,WSJ, NFL etc)*Frankly if you're going to purchase an ATV its worth your while to learn how to really take advantage of iTunes capabilities like using smart playlists.CONS:a) They've made your computers media a couple more clicks away than ATV 1 (you used to be able to access from top level (main screen). You have to choose "Computers" first..b) Requires Home Sharing (This is a free software service built into iTunes - which determines who can play and or copy your purchased media). While I've never had any problem (even with my PC) some folks (nearly all are PC users) do. It seems this is mostly do to firewall/router settings and/or 3rd party antivirus software. Nonetheless, if you run into an issue, you need to be willing to read thru Apple's KBs on the topic,  (or call Apple and have them walk your thru it if your still under warranty.)c) No way to backdate software without jailbreaking, AND, as of Apple TV Gen 2, you can't disable updates completely (you're asked before updating, but it gets to be a pain constantly clicking "Don't Update".)-- A WASH: Pro or Con depending on your needs so YMMV---the Remote: Lots of folks like how simple and small this is. Personally I'd rather have a remote that's less likely to land in the wash. There are actually quite a lot of "hidden" commands in the device - like holding down select while playing a video to select chapter, I believe most/all? of these documented online, but personally I'd prefer separate NAMED buttons.No Amazon Video Player: If you don't have another device which has the software, and you really prefer using amazon media only, you might prefer a different device. For me this is no biggy, since I play my amazon music thru the ATV, and watch the "free" Amazon Prime Instant videos (well sorta free, since I pay an annual fee to amazon for the privilege) thru my Blu-Ray player, or TV.

Reviews.Title: Really loving this
Reviews.Author: Mdawg
Reviews.Content: At first it was really complicated to figure out the whole apple tv, even its overall function, and was very offended to realize the herding attempt by apple /itunes as an only option to buy movies or music.........that was the negative.There is everything positive to say when it comes to 1080p. I have a vizio 42 inch hdtv with apps and ipad 2, iphone4 as my phone.........the apple tv is awesome. And that is all inclusive. Works grate every day, flip on master switch at plug in every morning and comes on everytime. The HD, is really amazng and with all items mentioned, the apple tv has the best filter for watching stuff thru. I highly recommend the rocketfish ultra thin hdmi cable for $20, really amazing picture. The sound filter in the apple tv is also the best.It has a very sleek remote control , the apple tv is like a control panel for all your needs, music movies , netflix, are the ones I use everyday. The kool thing with the wifi is I can have my ipad and walk around the house with the ipad camera on and it will mirror on the tv. Same with video. The mirroring option is awesome. I tend to just watch things thru the apple tv rather than watch it on my ipad, and mirror to my hdtv, the filter on the apple tv makes it come in clearer picture and sound and puts everything into full 1080p format.I highly recomend is product. Well worth the hundred bucks. Comes in a nice apple box. Top notch. Besides my tv can literally carry all my entertainment needs in a backpack.............I HAVE ARRIVED.And the telefunken stand for the ipad, with all this is a sweet setup that I will have a long time. Forever.The one really kool thing is the HD movies on itunes come in so real with this setup. My neigbor sed wow, it looks so real. And thats the plus of buying movies from itunes. The quality is awesome.

Reviews.Title: Really glad I have it
Reviews.Author: Heather Novak "hcgnovak"
Reviews.Content: Literally plugged it in and set it up in less than 5 minutes - not kidding.  I'm not an apple kool-aid drinker so I didn't want to buy an Apple TV until I truly saw a benefit I couldn't live without.  Being able to stream my movie library with minimal effort was the kicker in the end.  The only problem I have is that my PC needs to be logged in for the Apple Home Sharing to work.  Obviously that's not an issue with the Apple TV box, it's a setting on my PC that needs to be changed.

Reviews.Title: Skeptical
Reviews.Author: justanotheramazonianonamazon
Reviews.Content: I was skeptical at first, but with its Netflix capabilities and airplay the Apple TV has completely replaced my cable television!

Reviews.Title: Streaming is limited
Reviews.Author: I. Manni "spinfrog"
Reviews.Content: I purchased this product so that I could show content to my television without physically connecting them.  The streaming feature works only with designated content.  This content is not designated by me.  Instead on very limited items I can stream.  I wanted it to mirror my portable device.I was disappointed,David

Reviews.Title: Nice to have, but limited in what it can do
Reviews.Author: GaryS
Reviews.Content: I bought the Apple TV chiefly so I could watch movies off my ipad. The setup was very easy. The picture quality and sound are very good. However, I was just a little annoyed to find out Apple blocks Amazon movies from being played on the Apple TV. Big brother at it again. If Apple is so good, why bother blocking the competition? I still can watch other video on it though. Without the ability to watch Amazon videos, I wouldn't recommend it though. Mirroring from your ipad is nice to have, but as other reviewers have pointed out, there are better solutions out there than Apple TV.

Reviews.Title: Better than I had expected
Reviews.Author: Amazon Customer "Glenn W"
Reviews.Content: I bought an Apple TV to replace my Roku device on my family's main TV. I've had a Roku HD for the past year and a half which I've since moved to another TV. The Apple TV has Netflix and Hulu Plus on it which is what my family uses 99% of the time. Roku has more channels, but I rarely watched them. I do like having Spotify on the Roku, but with AirPlay I can easily run Spotify on my iPad and mirror it to my TV/sound system. I think this device is excellent for what it does. My only complaint with the Roku was that it was flaky and I had to reset it frequently. Whether that was the device itself or the software running the channel I don't know. Hopefully it's better with the newer Roku devices. I will still use my Roku on another TV. I also have most of my media in iTunes. If you have a Mac and/or several iOS devices then an Apple TV is worth consideration over Roku. I couldn't be happier with it. My kids enjoy AirPlay because one can play on the iPad while the others watch it on the TV. That solved the problem with my oldest son getting irritated by his younger brothers crowding around him to watch him play on the iPad.In summary, I think both Apple TV and Roku are capable devices. Having other Apple devices in the home was the deciding factor in purchasing an Apple TV for my family. If you don't have other Apple devices then Roku is likely a better choice.

Reviews.Title: Did I say I love it..
Reviews.Author: sattyFolsom
Reviews.Content: Did I say I love it...I could have love it more if they've more stuff (like Pandora, Crackles, FB, Disney TV app etc) or allowed to download those cool stuff from Apple store in it. Another thing - it should have used by my android tablet/phones-

Reviews.Title: One of the best little Apple products around
Reviews.Author: Hawaii Installer
Reviews.Content: As a home and business custom audio visual integrator, we've installed more Apple TVs in our systems than any other AV product on the market. The best feature on the Apple TV is Airplay with Video. With airplay, you can wirelessly stream audio and video from anywhere on the WiFi network. It's so easy to use and allows anyone with an Apple device (iPad, iPhone, Macbook) to stream their content without having to download software, drivers or connect external dongles.With an Apple TV connected to an AV receiver and/or a nice HDTV, the audio and video quality are top notch. The built in apps like Netflix, Hulu, YouTube, Vimeo and 1000s of internet radio stations provide great entertainment all in High Definition. However, if it's not on the Apple TV, then you can use Airplay to view and listen to whatever app from your iPhone etc.From a business usage standpoint, the ability to wirelessly stream slideshow or video presentations to any attached video display makes the Apple TV an inexpensive digital signage solution. The possibilities are truly limitless.PROS: Super easy to use and works seamlessly with other apple products. High quality audio and video experience. Airplay is awesome.CONS: Occasional loss of network connection can confuse some users but simply powering off and then back on will fix it. Lack of RCA audio outputs can be limiting for people with older AV equipment.

Reviews.Title: Another outstanding Apple product
Reviews.Author: tomd
Reviews.Content: The unit worked flawlessly right of the box. Easy to hook-up and use. Very versatile unit. Offers a variety movie programming sources. Replaced the Logic Revue, which never worked correctly.

Reviews.Title: Works well, but needs more apps.
Reviews.Author: Michael Poole "Amazonian Junkie"
Reviews.Content: The only reason I bought this over a Roku was it's ability to AirPlay my iPad. It's still a great piece of hardware, but if you want more options for content and don't have an iOS device to stream to it, then get a Roku.

Reviews.Title: Cool device
Reviews.Author: Bill Anderson
Reviews.Content: Work great - new to the techie world and this allow me to watch movies from my IPAD on my TV -- Good times

Reviews.Title: Easy setup, awesome features, SPEED!! Cable-Cutters search no more!
Reviews.Author: Leslie Ann
Reviews.Content: I've been using my Apple TV for several months now and I feel that I have enough experience with this product to author an adequate and honest review.Pros:Awesome packaging! Your Apple TV box slides out of the packaging sleeve revealing your awesome little black hockey puck of a media streamer. Pulling the Apple TV out of its box reveals the remote made of sleek aluminum. The remote feels solid, incredibly simple and almost familiar. Underneath the remote resides the power cable, sans bulky power block as the Apple TV's power supply is actually inside the device itself, and owner's manual/warranty information.Simple setup! Plugging your Apple TV into power and then into your HDTV or Projector with an HDMI cable (Amazon Basics HDMI recommended, quality at a low price!). You are greeted with a dead-simple interface. Language? Wifi Network name and password? Apple ID and password? Done! From box to Netflix took about 2 minutes, tops.Blazing fast interface! I finally have a replacement for the sluggish "Smart" options on my Samsung LED TV. Getting to the middle of my Netflix queue on my Samsung took around 5 actual minutes before we were watching the movie/TV show. My Apple TV does the same job in less than 60 seconds.Features! Streaming options include iTunes Movies/Music/TV Shows (for purchase and for rental), Netflix, Hulu, MLB.TV, NBA LeaguePass, NHL On Demand, Wall Street Journal Online, Flickr, Vimeo, Youtube, AirPlay (next bullet point), and more being added in updates! Since I have owned mine, they have added several streaming options.AirPlay! Definitely something that sets the Apple TV apart from the competition. With a single tap on an Apple mobile device (iPod Touch, iPad or iPhone), you can wirelessly send media content to your TV! You even have the option to mirror your device's screen to the TV! Anything you do on your mobile device can be seen on the TV! Web browsing, Apps (HBO Go and other streaming services that aren't natively on the Apple TV), games, email, documents, anything! Awesome! This feature even extends to Macs.**NOTE** You can get AirPlay to function on non-Apple devices! Download AirParrot on Windows and DoubleTwist on Android to enable your ability to mirror your device to your Apple TV, wirelessly.Connectivity! Built-in wifi and bluetooth connectivity allowing you to connect a bluetooth keyboard for quick login and search entry. Recommend the Apple Wireless keyboard as it is very thin and light, great for couch use!Cons:Missing some streaming services like NFL and HBO Go, though these services are available if you have a device that can AirPlay this content from the web or an app.No native component connections, though this is a rare need in today's HDMI world.My Setup:Cox High Speed Internet 50MbpsMotorola Surfboard Extreme DOCSIS 3.0Apple Airport Extreme RouterSamsung UN40ES6500 40 inch LED 120hz 1080pApple TV (3rd generation, 1080p)Amazon Basics HDMI cableIn summary, this device is well worth the $99. It exceeds expectations in every regard, and allowed my wife and I to become "Cable-Cutters" and drop our cable TV service completely. We went from spending ~$150/month on television and blurays, HBO, Showtime, Starz, etc to spending ~$50 with Hulu Plus, Netflix and various purchases and rentals from the iTunes store. It paid for itself in the first month!

Reviews.Title: awesome for mirroring ipad screen
Reviews.Author: Ken Clayton
Reviews.Content: I really like using the Apple TV to mirror my iPad screen on my HDTV. It was easy to setup and picture is perfect. Used cables before but this is 1000 times better.

Reviews.Title: Why did I wait...
Reviews.Author: Douglas Fowler "EnvironmentalIntegrator"
Reviews.Content: If you have an Ipad, Macbook, or other Apple device with AirPlay, you simply have to have this connected to your network and TV.  Being able to display what I'm looking at on my Ipad is worth the $100 by itself.  HBOGo, Cinemax apps work flawlessly going from my Ipad to my AppleTV.  Works just as good with my Macbook Pro and Imac.  COULD NOT BE HAPPIER WITH THIS PURCHASE.

Reviews.Title: It's apple
Reviews.Author: Adan Hernandez "Guaco wacko"
Reviews.Content: that's all I have to say. It's an Apple product. Compatibility with other apple products is as easy as it comes.  it works flawlessly!

Reviews.Title: Already sold on the previous model!
Reviews.Author: Louis "LNADO"
Reviews.Content: If you haven't gotten one of these, you should!  This is my second one.  One for the bedroom and one for the living room.Apple products, my iPhones and my iPad along with my computer can all connect together wireless and with ease...and this one's with 1080P!

Reviews.Title: Great so far
Reviews.Author: dallas bolen
Reviews.Content: I don't usually give 5 stars to anything, and I would give this a 4.5 if that was an option.  It was a little confusing to figure out the mirroring of my Ipad as it wasn't discussed in the set up manual at all.  Once you make sure the settings are appropriate on the apple tv -AirPlay(that part was easy).  Go to your Ipad, double click on the home button to where all your open apps show up on the bar at the bottom.  Drag to the right (which takes you to the screen to the left) where the music setting are and there is a button that has a square with a triangle in the middle of it, you have to activate the mirroring on your ipad to connect with the airplay on the apple tv. Here are the instructions from Apple.  [...]My only other beef is that my computer with Itunes must be up and running in order for the apple tv to stream my movies personal movies (not movies that I have purchased from ITunes) even though they have been moved into my itunes on the computer.  So, when I am away with the computer, no one can watch our personal movies on apple tv.  The primary reason I bought Apple TV as opposed to some other player was that I could wirelessly view the screen of my Ipad on the TV.

Reviews.Title: What it is!
Reviews.Author: D. Stinnett "Blu-Ray Kid"
Reviews.Content: Gets the TV signal from MacAir router to the TV perfectly, great product.As an aside, I tried twice to purchase this product from the Apple web site but even eith a phone call was unsuccessful. Purchased it on Amazon with no hassle and at a slightly better price. I'm sure that doesn't surprise any Amazon shoppers.

Reviews.Title: overpriced
Reviews.Author: George Wietor
Reviews.Content: Overpriced. Roku is more user friendly and a much better value while offering more features in today's market.I am using my Roku while the Apple TV sits idle.

Reviews.Title: Pretty Happy!
Reviews.Author: mw
Reviews.Content: I have to admit I have become an apple junkie and this is the latest edition to my apple toys.Here are the Pros:- Easy enough to install. You need a longer hdmi cable, be warned.- Works well with streaming movies and gives you the option to stream Netflix and Hulu which is pretty nice of Apple, considering it's a much cheaper way to watch movies than through Itunes.- When you do buy a movie through Itunes, the quality is wonderful. My husband pays the Verizon Fios bill, so we take turns as to who pays for the movie on demand. Wish Apple would lower their movie rental prices to compete with Redbox- Great for streaming your iPad or IMac onto your TV screen.- There are three different speeds to fast forward and backwards. Again, you would need to read the instructions to know about it.Here are the Cons:- The remote is not self explanatory and you need to read the instructions. I would have preferred to see a button on the remote which was marked "Select" instead of just a round silver button within a black circle with arrows pointing North, West, South and East. You need to figure out what that means. For non-techy people, the remote will be an issue.- To go backwards, you need to click the menu button.- To play, if you press the silver buttonBe aware, it needs it's own HDMI input on your television. The better the hdmi connector you use, the better your picture will be. Also, in my opinion, it's better to use an ethernet cable than wireless, especially as our TV area is pretty far from the wireless router. All in all, I'm pretty happy with this, but I am a techno junkie.

Reviews.Title: Nice Item
Reviews.Author: nectoreene
Reviews.Content: Got these for gifts and they came a bit later than I expected but not too much.  I liked my purchase.

Reviews.Title: Solid
Reviews.Author: Thunderhead22
Reviews.Content: This is just what I needed. I had been using a mini-port to HDMI cable to mirror my Mac. Worked great for several months. When I downloaded an HD trailer and tried to play it, the connection flickered out. I tried two different cables to no avail. the connection would come and go (mostly go). I had never been interested in an ATV, but research indicated that it might be a good way to mirror the Mac. Ordered it, set it up, bang: off to the races (I have a late 2011 MBP, so air-play works fine). It is what it is. I don't do a lot of streaming, so I'm not missing the access to various venues mentioned by others. I like the interface with iTunes. The initial reason for my interest in connecting the computer to my home theater system (such as it is) was the ability to drive high impedance headphones. I also enjoy the interface with YouTube. Those rotating still frames are pretty cool. My often lame DSL is slow to load content (and sometimes just fails) but that's not the fault of the ATV. As for mirroring, my only disappointment is the slight lag time. I work in graphics programs via a Wacom tablet and this slight lag is not a good thing (but I don't mind working directly on the Mac these projects). If my local Apple store wasn't constantly crowded, I would have spent some time at the genius bar to see what's up with the lightening port (Apple Care wasn't able to get it figured out, and I found many blog posts about the problem). Bottom line: For basic use, this is a solid product. I don't regret buying it. Oh, BTW, the free remote  app works great with my iPod 5G. That's a definite plus.

Reviews.Title: What a gadget
Reviews.Author: Raymond A. Thorne "razor"
Reviews.Content: This little box has gotten me away from my computer, and watching Hulu and Netflex on my television. The remote is the neatest gadget. All of my other remotes have many buttons. The Apple TV's remote has three, and it is amazing what those three buttons allows you to control.

Reviews.Title: Waiting on Newer Version (Apple TV 3,2)
Reviews.Author: R. Jones
Reviews.Content: I purchased the Apple TV 3 days before the announcement that Apple had planned on silently releasing a new version of the Apple TV 3, currently being called 3,2 (designated model 1469). This information was discovered when Apple filed with the FCC regarding a newer device. The (4mm) smaller Apple TV will have the A5X chip and new low-power dual-band 40nm Broadcom BCM4334 chip that is present in new iDevices like the iPhone 5. This is not a major upgrade, and the average user will not notice a difference. However, I would rather wait a few more weeks and purchase the newest device available.

Reviews.Title: Great Product
Reviews.Author: Lib
Reviews.Content: The Apple TV new version it's a great product, extremely useful and very easy to use. I recommend buying for everyone!

Reviews.Title: Awesome but cannot stream amazon prime
Reviews.Author: K. Gervais
Reviews.Content: Excellent product.  Ditched the expensive cable bills and started steaming content from netflix, hulu, etc. product works awesome.  Small, discrete, in line with the top notch quality you expect from apple products. I DO wish apple and amazon would stop the feuding and exclusivity rights war to their content, however, as I cannot stream ANY amazon prime content through this and that (quite frankly) sucks.  I'd have to reccommend roku if that is your desire ( and I  can only go by the feedback I've read as I do not own one) as I understand yo can stream ANYTHING through them.  If you want an awesome product and do not care about streaming amazon prime content....buy this & you will not be disappointed. 4* rating due to inability to stream amazon content , otherwise would be a 5* product.

Reviews.Title: When Apple adds more apps, I will reconsider a higher rating
Reviews.Author: R. LUCAS "RustyGumbo"
Reviews.Content: Pros: AirPlay mirroring, Super Compact, Easy Set Up, Great User Interface, 1080Cons:  Limited Apps, AirPlay mirroring blocked by Comcast/HBO using portable devices (iPad, iPhone), Doesn't work with other devices, no control of AirPlay when mirroring from iMac in other room.My favorite feature with Apple TV is the AirPlay mirroring.  When I am visiting friends without cable, Netflix or Hulu, or on the road traveling, I can easily get access to these shows or live streaming if I bring my ATV along with my iPad and connect to an HDMI device.But, outside of ATV's AirPlay mirroring, I am left wondering what else can I do?Apps on ATV are very limiting.  If you are buying this for the current app line up and not Airplay Mirroring, I suggest buying a Wireless Sony Blue Ray DVD player.  Head to head, the DVD player has far more usable apps than Apple does, it plays DVDs, Blue Rays, and even does 3D DVDs... and cost $130 vs $95.  Well worth the extra $35... but it doesn't do AirPlay mirroring.When using AirPlay mirroring, I am limited to controlling streaming from the device which is being mirrored.  With the iPad this isn't a problem... but if I am using the iMac which is located on the other end of the house, this isn't fun, but is good exercise.  I can't even pause a movie.  If your question is why don't you just mirror it from your iPad, well the answer is that not everything can be mirrored from portable devices.  Comcast & HBO have blocked the ability to mirror from your iPad/iPhone, but not the case from my iMac.  It would be nice if the ATV gave some control to pause the iMac in the other room.UPDATE to Mirroring:  HBO recently updated their app and I can now mirror HBO Go on my Apple TV from my iPad.  Additionally, I have been able to use the remote to pause, rewind and fast forward... or simply use my iPad to control everything.  This is a much better improvement and makes me raise my star review to 4 stars.After getting the ATV, I shelled out $25 for a yearly subscription to iTune's Match.  That was 3 weeks ago and 90% of my music has been uploaded.  The first 80% took a few hours, the remaining 20% is taking forever because the music wasn't matched from iTunes catalog.  I understand some of my music isn't on iTunes, but there seems to be some that is on iTunes that isn't getting matched from the iTunes library.  Match allows me to AirPlay my music from the Cloud in another room with ATV without connecting to my computer.  This is especially useful when on the road.Not all Netflix & Hulu apps are the same and ATV wins easily for their interface.  I have these services built in on my Vizio Via TV in our bedroom and the Sony Blue Ray in our living room.  Apple TV wins easily in user interface.  The Sony comes last in quality.  It is a bit wonky, the layout is weird, and reading titles is nearly impossible.  The Vizio is a bit better, but is also limiting.  The Apple TV is clear, easy to navigate and even gives you extra search features in Netflix.  For example, on some movies you can go to the cast list and click on each cast member to find other movies they appear in. The layout is well thought out and easy to navigate. Great!I have high hopes for ATV in the future.  Coming from Apple, I expected more Apps and they should be delivering on this ASAP.  Additionally, giving the user two way control using AirPlay mirroring is much needed.  I should be able to pause my iMac in another room from my ATV.  Finally, ATV will reign supreme if the user can also mirror and control a remote computer from another room on a television using a keyboard/mouse or trackpad... in essence, giving the user the feeling of having a 2nd computer in another room.This is what I expect from Apple and until then I really can't give it a better rating.

Reviews.Title: Great Apple Product
Reviews.Author: Daniel Clement
Reviews.Content: This is a great product by apple, and I love it.Some things to consider:APPLE TV DOES NOT SUPPORT OLDER TVS. ONLY OUTPUTS THROUGH HDMI.To enjoy it to its max, you probably want an iTunes account, Netflix account, etc.What comes with the Apple TV is what you get. No app store like Roku.For me, with a Netflix account, YouTube account(not required), and iTunes account, and iPod Touch, it's very worth what I paid for.

Reviews.Title: 3G Apple TV w/ AirPlay Makes Brilliant Home Entertainment System
Reviews.Author: Jeremy Floyd
Reviews.Content: Using two Apple TVs and an Airport Express, I have created 3 zones with connected speakers in my home. This is wonderful for playing music from iTunes or my families iOS devices. From any audio application on iPhones or iPads it is easy to send the audio to the Apple TV and even mirror the video to the Apple TV.It's not perfect. We also have a Roku device to connect with nearly all other streaming multimedia applications that we use such as Pandora, Amazon Instant, HBO Go, etc. Apple TV however makes easy browsing of Internet video services.Setup is quick and painless, and you can easily access your Apple music and video library.

Reviews.Title: ATV3
Reviews.Author: Will Shakespeare
Reviews.Content: Have to say that this is quite a clever box of tricks. Before purchasing, I did a lot of research including Apple forums and other instant streaming devices such as Roku. In the end, it is about personal choices and what works for you. I should also state that although I have an iPhone and the wife has an iPad, we are not committed to Apple products we have to have no matter what. Having said that, I DO like the minimalist styling of both the unit and its remote.The ATV3 is Apple's 3rd version and besides a few tweaks at previous bugs, the essential difference between this version and the previous ATV2, is that this one supports 1080p HD whereas ATV2 was restricted to a max of 720p. To some that matters, but I personally cannot detect the difference from my sofa! Also, when I checked where it was available to buy, the best deal was on Amazon itself for $88! Free shipping and no sales tax, too. Normal retail is $99 plus tax and the 3-4 days wait wasn't a problem either.The set-up was straighforward. Yes, you could follow the booklet that came with it but all you needed, was the instructions on the screen and you were up and running. You can have it set up wirelessly (WiFi, with a router) or an Ethernet cable (wired). My specific set up was I have a NETGEAR dual band WiFi router in the office next door that provides a wifi hotspot for the wife's iPad and my iPhone (when not using Verizon's 4G network). This particular router stated that it was designed for medium to large homes, several devices simultaneously being used and that it supported streaming HD video. My 7 year-old TV is also capable of 1080p HD res.The box comes with the small, black ATV, a power cord and the Apple remote. You WILL also need a HDMI cable to connect it to your TV, if you don't already have one. You don't need to buy a state-of-the art one with gold plating that'll set you back up to $50; they are available for as little as $20 at Radio Shack or Fry's. Mine was one left by my TV cable company when I switched to using a CableCard instead of using one of their bulky box tops.Had the ATV for a few months now and I'm still learning what you can do with it! It's a work in progress. I would highly recommend getting a book on this device, especially one that includes trouble-shooting. There is one available on this site and it DOES cover the ATV3.
