Having this companion, I found, is very useful and not too technical following each chapter, depending what it is you're looking for.All in all, I have no regrets in buying this product as I already had the other devices with which it runs. About my only criticism is that the library content on say, Netflix, is not as wide as on the regular mail-in DVD. If you do a search on either, you are more likely to find the physical DVD format available as the same movie as instant streaming. Apple's good but even it and iTunes are not 100% perfect! Maybe they will add more content and encourage more consumers. Already other companies are giving them a good run for their money and there's nothing like healthy competition to get a company to give the consumers what they want, rather than what they think they need!!.......

Reviews.Title: Wow!! 1080 looks great
Reviews.Author: dickpimento
Reviews.Content: This is such an easy to use and necessary accessory to anyone that has a Macbook Pro, IPad or even Iphone.  The picture looks fantastic!  And it takes up very little space and uses almost no electricity.  Our Blu-Ray Player has not been turned on since we hooked up Apple Tv.  A couple of things to note before buying this product:1.  You must update your Macbook Pro Operating System to Mountain Lion to use it with Apple TV.  Mirroring will not work otherwise.  There is a cost of $20 to do this update and it will change your computer in many ways (including slowing it down and taking longer to boot up).  However, after using cords to connect my computer to my tv, I will take the bad qualities of Mountain Lion anytime.  The sound comes through crystal clear, picture is great.2.  Mirroring does not look very good coming from IPhone or IPad 2.But there are so many great things about this.  We are purchasing a surround sound system since it picks up the shared music on my itunes.Netflix looks great and HD comes through wonderfully.  I also love the "Remote" app on my iphone, which allows me to control the apple tv from my phone.  No need for a remote!!!! My wife and I can both have our own remotes and control the music, shows and pictures at the drop of a hat.With technology, comes convenience and this product made my life a lot easier.Thank you Apple

Reviews.Title: Good not Great
Reviews.Author: Patrick Smith
Reviews.Content: Got this about a week ago and am a bit disappointed with the content, there isn't that much of it.  Since you can watch Netflix and Hulu on just about anything these days, DO NOT BUY IT FOR THAT.  The best part by far is having your iTunes library available through your TV and the ability to use AirPlay to project your iPhone, iPad, and Mac screen to the TV Screen.You're basically paying $95 to listen to your music through your TV (and I have surround sound so i admit my music sounds amazing when I'm using the treadmill) and project images to your TV wirelessly.  Some say its worth it, some say its not.  All a matter of opinion, I think think its nice to have, but I wouldn't buy it again.  This thing would be awesome to receive as a gift.If you want more content options, like news, HBO GO, sports, things of that nature, go with the Roku HD.  If you want to project images from your apple device to your TV (which is very nice at times) go with this.This product seems like a slam dunk 3-star review to me.

Reviews.Title: Great for iOS homes but lacking in video sources
Reviews.Author: AwesomeDude
Reviews.Content: Pros: The best in home networking with other iOS devices. Connects flawlessly and integrates smoothly.Cons: Besides Netflix and Hulu, there really isn't much this thing offers in the video department. And you're insane if you think I'm gonna rent/buy from the Apple store with their prices. Things like Crackle, Xfinity, HBO/Cinemax Go aren't available so there really isn't much content.Fortunately I still have an Xbox 360.

Reviews.Title: So disappointing, I wish aTV was great/even good...
Reviews.Author: JL "Nikonian"
Reviews.Content: Out of the box, aTV "found" my iPod 4th gen.  I was able to display pics off of the iPod... that was it.  No vids, no games (mirroring), nope - nothing else.  Thought about returning it then, but decided to wait to see how well it works with a new MBP.MBP (2.6GHz i7 16GB, dual 7.2k rpm hd): what a waste of my time.  I upgraded to ML just for aTV...  Yes, mirroring worked, but not like for viewing movies at full resolution/24fps.  My MBP was 12' from the router, the aTV located 8' from the router.  (btw, a $130 Linksys/Cisco N router).  As for "mirroring", well, slow at best - most of the time there was a 12 sec delay... on anything.  So frustrating.  I "reverted" back to Lion where Airplay worked for pics...  oh but not so well for vids/movies.iPad 2nd/iPad mini- oh forget it.  Decided to return the aTV to Amazon.Pros:  Can display pics on the iPod/iPad very well on your home lcd.  This has great potential for photo studio purposes if one uses wireless units in their dSLRs.  aTV has really nice screen saver and the menu driven interface is as one would expect from Apple products.  Intuitive, easy to use, high quality.  Wireless configuration was such a breeze!  The packaging for this is second to none.  The included remote works with other Mac/Apple products - very nice.Cons: Video files cannot be some of the more popular file formats.  Basically, they all need to be in Apple's iTunes compatible formats.  Price is a bit high, but consistent o all Apple's products...  ( this would have been my 6/7th Apple product).The concept of being able to display my MBP screen onto a selectable (if you have more than one aTV in your location) LCD in my home/office wirelessly is really cool.  Maybe in the next release this will work.  BTW, for AirPlay works on Lion - you do not have to upgrade to ML.

Reviews.Title: Nice quality, limited use
Reviews.Author: Real Music-Not Rap
Reviews.Content: I use the Apple TV mainly for streaming Nexflix content to my television, and it works flawlessly for that purpose.  Setup was a breeze, and picture quality is also excellent, with hardly any need for buffering, but that can be due to cable usage in my neighborhood, or something else not necessarily the fault of the Apple TV.  Anyway, Apple needs to add more content, as I'm sure they eventually will, since Netflix (and Hulu Plus, if you so desire) are the only things worthwhile to me so far.  Yes, you can subscribe to sports programming but I'm not interested in those, and YouTube's quality varies immensely.  You can also play music from your computer (provided your computer is a recent model, and your OS is newer) to your stereo but I don't see the point of playing a low-fidelity medium on a high-fidelity system, and photos can also be streamed directly to your television.  All in all, a great product, albeit, limited in variety, so far.  However, if you subscribe to Netflix for its streaming then it is worth it for that alone.

Reviews.Title: Perfect for the iFamily
Reviews.Author: Will "wsmithapple"
Reviews.Content: Not sure how Apple has packed so much into such a small and affordable device. We've had 1st and 2nd generation AppleTV the 2nd gen has no internal hd and uses a ton less energy. I being the tech geek of the house had my doubts about being completely reliant on streaming which the 2nd and 3rd generation Atv's are. Over the past 2yrs Apple has made major improvements to the iOS and many services (streaming) make the device a great value. In the early days I did feel crippled by the lack of options but that is no longer an issue for example MLB network is now available if you have an MLB account. And then there are the obvious options like Netflix and streaming from your networked computers (that are running iTunes). My guess is things will only get better as Apple continues to add services through iCloud and hopefully streaming of live TV. Even without those the device is a bargain and completely idiot proof. :-)Note you can stream many cable channels via iPad - iPhone - iPod apps in HD. For example we often stream news channels like CNN to our Apple TV on our bedroom TV via my iPhone. However most apps require you have a TV provider... We have Dish sat service (only one receiver in our family room) having that account lets us use apps like CNN to watch their live streaming.Bottom line this is a great device and even greater if you have iDevices in your home. A great value.

Reviews.Title: Apple has done it again!
Reviews.Author: Robert CC
Reviews.Content: I will always be loyal to my Apple products, and this one for sure has yet to let me down!It is fast, has heaps of cool features like Airplay, Remote App, and many other devices.Make sure you don't buy a blu-ray streaming player if all you use is youtube etc. The interface and remotes that come with other blu-ray streaming players don't function as well as this TV.Going to buy one for my wife for Christmas, oh and it looks great too so that's a bonus.

Reviews.Title: Apple TV Is Better! (Old Title: The Roku2 XS Is A Much More Versatile Product)
Reviews.Author: Consumer Advocate
Reviews.Content: Updated review:After Amazon reviewer sandvfan pointed out that the "channels" that I said Apple TV lacked were actually hidden under Podcast, I went to an Apple Store to check out this feature. And indeed, there is a huge treasure chest of video and audio Podcasts - much more comprehensive that what Roku has, and the menu system and search feature are excellent.Yesterday, I returned the Roku 2 XS that I bought at Costco, and bought myself an Apple TV. I can overlook Apple TV's lack of Amazon Instant Video because my Blu-ray player has that feature.Old review:I tried both the latest Apple TV (third generation) and Roku 2 XS before deciding on the Roku.In short, the only advantage of Apple TV is its tight integration with iTunes. I also like its remote controller better.But if you are into high quality, free channels, the Apple TV pales by comparison. Even the least costly Roku LT ($50) supports 400+ channels. The channels that I use most are Amazon Instant Video (Amazon Prime members can watch free movies), Crackle (free movies), Cnet, Revision3, Tested, TED, and a number of news channels.Apple TV does NOT support Amazon Instant Video. It is a closed system, compared to Roku's vendor-neutral design. Even though I have many Apple products, I had to choose the more versatile Roku over the rather limited Apple.You can try out Apple TV at a Apple Store, and you can buy a Roku 2 XS at Costco which you can return within 90 days if you are not satisfied. The Roku at Costco is a special bundle: Roku 2 XS, HDMI cable, and 2 months of Hulu+ free - all for $90. The only thing I don't like about the Roku is its paltry 90-day warranty. Reviews on the Amazon site do not seem to indicate unreliable hardware, so I am not too concerned about this aspect. You can use the Chase Amazon credit card to buy this and get a doubling of the warranty to 180 days.

Reviews.Title: Overall very pleased with this product
Reviews.Author: Megan Cabral
Reviews.Content: Pros: It is crystal clear compared to my BluRay player's similar apps (Netflix, Hulu, etc)Cons: The remote is difficult to use for typing.For the most part, I am very pleased with this product. It is far better than the apps I was using on my BluRay player to accomplish the same things. The addition of the Watch ESPN app is a great feature that I can't wait to use this football season (requires a subscription).The one thing I don't like is typing with the tiny remote control. My email address is rather long, as are all my passwords, making signing in to apps very cumbersome with this remote. The navigation is slightly difficult with the toggle button on the remote (my large thumb sometimes activates the wrong side of the switch). But this is definitely not a deal breaker for me. It would be great if I could connect my wireless keyboard to it for sign in purposes and searching.Overall, I very highly recommend this product. It's another example of a long line of Apple products that are clearly ahead of the game.

Reviews.Title: Nice when it works but poor quality from Apple
Reviews.Author: M. Crawford
Reviews.Content: Apple TV is great for Netflix and quickly ordering movies from Apple.  For those unfamiliar with Netflix, the interface actually does vary between devices you use to access the service.  Apple TV provides the best Netflix interface I have seen  The Radio app is also a great feature, 100's of stations to choose from.  The photo streaming is nice if you have flikr or icloud, but is clunkier than you would expect to set up.  By far the best feature if you have apple devices like iPad, iPhone, etc.  is the ability to show audio, video or mirror your screen from your device.  Lots of fun to surf Youtube videos this way.  if you get tired of the radio stations, it is straightforward to stream something like Pandora from your iPod, just one button to push.  The only problem is poor quality, especially the wifi connection.  The support forums are full of horror stories with this device.  My wifi just stopped working after 9 months.  Trying to get warranty service for it, but its really a poor showing from Apple.  If you buy it, cross your fingers and hope for the best--and maybe spring for the extended support contract for this one.  Usually that's a money loser, but it will likely pay off for this product.

Reviews.Title: AirPlay
Reviews.Author: Waxtoy
Reviews.Content: AirPlay is the reason I bought 2 of them. I stream my photo album, music and videos from my iPad, iPhone and laptop through Apple TV to my receiver and it looks and sounds great. Very very cool feature and makes it stand out from Roku and other players. There is a app for Apple TV called Remote that's free lets you control your Apple TV with swipe gestures.

Reviews.Title: Like every other streaming solution, good but not great. (vs Google TV vs Roku)
Reviews.Author: J. Banks
Reviews.Content: I'm sure I am going to take a lot of flack for saying this since a lot of people love everything apple does, but this Apple TV is just OK.  Before you start clicking the unhelpful button let me set things up for you a bit.  I have a fair sized library of music but not many movies in my iTunes.  On the other hand, I have a lot of my personal DVD's burned to my windows server and can watch them throughout the house on other devices such as my Google TV blu-ray player, or my 1st generation Roku XS,Owning all 3 devices, here is a quick list of plus and minusesAppleTV+Netflix+AirPlay from iPad (Air Parrot from MacBook Pro)+YouTube (Kinda)+Cool screensaver and remote content+iTunes protected content+Podcast support+Hulu-No Amazon VOD-No DLNA support-No USB Drive supportRoku+Amazon VOD+Netflix+USB Drive Support+Hulu+Plex (All my movies available from my server in a great UI)+YouTube-No DLNA-No DRM Movies-1st gen can be slowGoogle TV+Netflix+BluRay+Native DLNA Support+USB Drive Support+Great Remote-No Hulu-No Itunes DRM SupportIf you could combine all 3 of these products you would have one great device (A Jailbroken ATV2 is almost perfect).  For me though being an Amazon Prime member, and a Hulu+ member the fact that Apple TV doesn't Support either is a pain.Another thing that is a bummer in the iTunes ecosystem is the price.  A quick glance at Amazon vs iTunes on a movie like The Avengers shows that iTunes rental costs $1 more, and to buy the movie costs an additional $5 over Amazon.  I can't figure out why that is.Basically, if you are heavily invested in Apple and iTunes you will love this device.  It has the slickest UI and operated Apple smooth.  If you are not, I think there are better options.

Reviews.Title: Volume problems
Reviews.Author: Mejojobo "Sad Neighbor"
Reviews.Content: The new version of Apple TV does not have volume control and doesn't work if you are using an amp to send the signal throughout your house.

Reviews.Title: Great for AirPlay Mirroring in the Classroom
Reviews.Author: Allison Urda
Reviews.Content: I have used Apple TV with a projector in my elementary classroom. I can stream everything on my projector from my iPad. In addition, I also use the Apple TV at home to watch movies and television shows. It's a great product for the money.

Reviews.Title: AIRPLAY IS THE BUSINESS!
Reviews.Author: Kenta Kamohara
Reviews.Content: The main reason I purchased the AppleTV was for the Airplay feature. Shipping with AmazonPrime is always fast so I received my product on time. Installation for the AppleTV to my Home Theater System was very simple. Make sure you have an HDMI cable ready because this does not come with one. (I didn't have an extra one so I had to buy another HDMI cable online which prolonged my AppleTV usage for another 2 days) The Airplay feature works amazingly great! I'm very surprised of how easy it was to actually use this feature. At first, I thought I had to install a software, but once the AppleTV was connected, there was an Airplay icon that appeared on my Macbook that I click and BAM! Your desktop is on TV. Resolution on the TV is very nice and it also sends the audio to the TV. I connected this to my Home Theater System so the audio is surround sound as well.The only complaint that I have is when you're connecting to the Wifi, it does not scan for available networks; therefore, you can't click on the available SSID and connect to it. You physically have to type the EXACT SSID. This took me a while because I didn't capitalize a letter, forgot to put a symbol, didn't put correct spacing...etcAlso, I already had the remote control for my macbook pro (Remote configured to my macbook) so I decided to use this remote instead of the one that came with it.Since the remote is already synced with my Macbook, every time use the remote to go through the AppleTV, this would also increase/decrease the volume for my Macbook which was a bit annoying.Photo stream works just as great as it did with my iphone and Macbook. (It does take a while to load all the photo stream photo's onto the Apple TV)The movies that were being offered through the AppleTV were a bit pricey, but that's what Redbox is for.My only intensions of using the AppleTV is solely for Airplay. Once you set everything up, usage is simple and I'm glad that I purchased the AppleTV.Another fine product from Apple!

Reviews.Title: Works okay, but...
Reviews.Author: Scott
Reviews.Content: Does not work with Amazon Instant Video App!  I would not have purchased it if I had known this.  Bummer.

Reviews.Title: Sometimes a pain, but mostly great
Reviews.Author: robk64
Reviews.Content: The original Apple TV had a built-in hard drive.  You would buy media on your computer, and send it to the Apple TV as you would your iPod, iPhone, or iPad (other devices with hard drives) but wirelessly via your home Wi-Fi network.  Now, the Apple TV streams.  There's just enough storage on the device to hold buffer data, but the concept is that it streams the data.  Which means, the computer has to be on, and iTunes has to be open.  I think.  At least, that's the only way it works for me.  If the Internet goes down (problem with the ISP, cable cut, bad storm, whatever), you will have a tough time watching anything via the Apple TV.With the original Apple TV, after sending media to the device, I could turn off the computer, disconnect from the Internet, and watch and listen to whatever resided on the Apple TV's hard drive.  It'd be nice if Apple could bring back the previous capabilities while retaining the current form-factor and other improvements of the current Apple TV.  For now, as long as the Internet is up, and my computer doesn't crash, it works great.

Reviews.Title: Love it!
Reviews.Author: Mateus A.
Reviews.Content: I cancelled my cable TV and bought an Apple TV. The best deal I made in recent times. Saved a lot of money and improved the quality of information I have access to.

Reviews.Title: So Easy to Use!
Reviews.Author: Patricia R.
Reviews.Content: Apple TV is a great streaming device. The setup is simple. The convenience of the apple productscompatibility is a big plus.A nice feature is that we can show photos on our TV.Netflix works perfectly, but Amazon Prime movies are very slow to download. However, that problem is solved by downloading Amazon Prime movies on an iPad and turning on the mirroring feature.Another great feature is the remote app for iPhone.I really recommend Apple TV for an easy way to stream movies and more.

Reviews.Title: great for 99 bucks
Reviews.Author: Michael T Pitcher
Reviews.Content: They keep coming out with more and more apps.  I especially love that MLBtv and NBA league pass are available through this device.  Typically speaking can also rent movies for cheaper through this then onDemand with my cable provider.  Airplay with laptop or iPad is also pretty damn cool.If they added an Amazon Prime video app it would be the cherry on top.

Reviews.Title: Super easy setup... Perfect for sending what's on my iPad screen to a projector... Possibly better than Roku
Reviews.Author: Bob Tobias "Robert Tobias"
Reviews.Content: I bought this for one reason, to mirror what is displayed on my iPad to a projector.  That it can stream from other sources is nice but I already have lots of devices that can do it as well... well, it turns out not "as well", but "too" More on that later.Setup was laughably easy.  I plugged it in, turned it on, waited less than a minute, and it displayed a message on the screen that I should tap it with my iPhone.  I wasn't sure why but I always do what technology tells me to so tap I did.  Apparently there is some magic where the tap transferrs details about my home network because a few seconds later the Apple TV was connected to my home wireless system!  No remembering WEP names or WPA2 keys or even if I'm using WEP or WPA.  Just a tap and I was done!  (BTW, *nobody* should be using WEP as just about anyone can crack in in less than a day.)Sending my iPad screen to the projector just started to work.  I select Airplay on the home screen and whatever is on my screen is also on my... screen.  I couldn't ask for more.As for the stuff it does that is the "same" as Roku and every DVD player and video game made in the past several years; this provides the clearest, most responsive, and user frientliest interface I've seen.  Too bad it doesn't stream Amazon content.  "Why can't we all just get along?"Because of the way Amazon reviews are displayed I doubt anyone will get a chance to see this before it gets buried under a ton more of what I expect will be equally glowing praises.  If you do find it helpful I hope you will fine a way to let me and Amazon know.  More importantly, unless the Amazon content thing is a show stopper or you really like having a wireless headset built into your remote, then I think Apple TV is wll worth your consideration when trying to decide on a media streaming device.

Reviews.Title: Great fun
Reviews.Author: Ancient Mariner "Proud Republican"
Reviews.Content: This tiny box is all you need to go with a high quality but dumb 1080 TV and WiFi to complete any streamingentertainment you want.It's fast, simple to hook up and configure, and use.The only problem is the excellent remote is so tiny, it's easy to misplace it.

Reviews.Title: A great product from Apple.
Reviews.Author: James
Reviews.Content: I had a hard time with the idea of purchasing this, because my LG 50PZ950 TV has interfaces for many of the online streaming services.  I couldn't bring myself to spend $99 for an item that might not be any better than what I already have.Fortunately I received one as a birthday present, and I love it!  I use my personal Apple TV primarily for Netflix, and to play music.  I purchased a second Apple TV for my bedroom for the same reason.  Being a part of the Apple ecosystem, I find that the device works really well.  I found that iTunes runs far better on the Mac than its Windows counterpart.  When Vista came out, I made the switch to Mac, and haven't regretted it.PROS:I find the interface far more intuitive than the one on the TV, and easier to use.  Using my iPhone and iPad as a remote control adds further ease of use, as I can use the touch screen to type, rather than the Apple Remote.I like the ability to stream music from my computer to my TVs.  Being a Mac user, this is an easy link to set up.  I turn on my TV many mornings just to listen.Airplay Mirroring is a great feature.  On occasion I use my TV as an additional monitor for my laptop.  This is an important feature at my office.  We hooked one up in our conference room to enable an easy hook up to our TV display.  It makes connecting extremely painless, and wireless.CONS:The biggest downside that I have is that they don't have an Amazon interface.The iTunes movie store / rental system is a bit pricy.  If I wish to rent a movie, I will usually switch over to my SmartTV to save a few bucks.

Reviews.Title: apple Tv
Reviews.Author: Empiror22
Reviews.Content: I first must say that I develop private apps for both apple ios and android.  In saying that i want it to be clear that i like both platforms.Ok to the review.  I own this apple tv , roku 3, chrome cast and amazon firetv, I'm a cord cutter, tired of paying the huge cable bills.  So this review will have a pros and cons that considers the four "tv boxes" versus each other.ApplePros: smooth operations as far as the software goes (best  i have used), works great with all apple productsCons: software is smooth because apple limits the developers by only allowing certain looks and interactions, doesn't work with some other branded products, very limited apps. limited processor versus some of the others.Roku 3Pros: great overall box, largest number of apps (channels), smooth operations.Cons: no real cons except the slower processor (doesn't have a huge effect now but may in the future)ChromecastPros: Cost (cheapest of the four), easy install, size (smallest), cost, cost, costCons: need a computer or ipad/iphone/tablet or some other type of controller to operate, wifi reception is a little weak, buffers more than the others, has limited number of apps, has a limited processor.Amazon FireTvPros: best processor, with newest firmware as of may 29 2014 is very smooth, rapid growing number of apps, the voice search is nice and has improved.Cons: not many, i love this guy and will probably buy another one.To conclude i hope apple will allow for a little variety in their apps and open the API to the public.  I also hope that apple releases a new apple tv with improvements (basically to match the other in hardware).People who are apple fans will love this product, people who have a lot of apple products will love it, people with no apple products will be ok with it, and people who prefer other operating systems (windows, android, linux, etc) will probably prefer the Roku 3 (or maybe chrome cast,or amazon FireTv).

Reviews.Title: Awesome
Reviews.Author: Kristen D
Reviews.Content: We love this. We choose not to have cable and this is the perfect amount of tv for us. I have noticed updates coming through over the last week or so. That's a nice touch. The remote is TINY. We are always losing it. But other than that we do love the Apple TV.

Reviews.Title: Apple TV is easy and fun
Reviews.Author: Rob Oliynik
Reviews.Content: Easy to set up. Easy to use. Great selection of programs with none of the commercials. Great value for the money

Reviews.Title: Does what it says, but function follows form to an annoying level
Reviews.Author: IFK
Reviews.Content: My main complaints about the Apple TV focus on the remote and the UI.  Both coupled together are minimalist to the point where I could easily see them being very challenging for someone to use, whether or not they are age 50+.  Given the nature of the device mishaps with the remote are not without cost - rewinding your Netflix stream and watching it rebuffer to YouTube quality c. 2006 is not pleasant.  Perhaps if the UI was a bit more informative it'd make up for the remote's shortcomings, but no.I'll also add that the remote is so damn small it is very easily lost - between sofa cushions, underneath papers and magazines, etc etc.  I was ready to take a power drill to the stupid thing and attach a lanyard, but I bought a Fire TV instead.  It too is not without issue (where the hell is Cloud Player?) but it is far and away more user-friendly.Overall - a competent but not inspired piece of equipment.  It's great for NetFlix when you don't have a "smart" TV, and that's pretty much all I have ever used it for.  AirPlay streaming is nice; needing to constantly keep a computer on to use it is not.  I'd much prefer for iTunes to have something like Amazon Cloud Player's "upload the music you already own" feature, and stream it over the Internet.

Reviews.Title: One of the best streamers out there!
Reviews.Author: W. Rapanault
Reviews.Content: As an owner of all kinds of streamers including roku 3 and PS4, Apple TV has is really climbing the ranks for me. Of course it's dependent on your wireless connection but everything I've watched so far has worked beautifully and picture is crystal clear. The new remote for the newest 2014 version is a little too small for my tastes but I'm getting used to it as well as the button layouts on it. For me, the real draw of Apple TV was to be able to stream my iTunes content to my hd TV. Again, I've had no issues at all and everything loads relatively fast(depending on connection). Lastly, another big draw is the AIRPLAY function which is pretty cool. This allows you to play whatever is on your iPad or iPhone on your tv through Apple TV. Comes in handy especially with apps that aren't available on the device like amazon instant video. And that's the one drawback of Apple TV, not enough apps available yet. It's got netflix and hbo go(which are the two big ones) but not much more. But something tells me that will change in the future.

Reviews.Title: Apple TV
Reviews.Author: Dennis Mitzel
Reviews.Content: Very pleased easy to use. I also have a Roku. But this is a better product. I would recommend to anybody.

Reviews.Title: Great product at a great price!
Reviews.Author: KSparky
Reviews.Content: We purchased this apple tv box for our HD tv in our family room.  We use it all the time.  It does require that you have Internet capabilities on your tv (which most newer tvs already have).  We own several apple products and we are able to sync up our music, photos, Netflix, and Youtube accounts for tv viewing/listening.  We do still have a cable box too and we switch back and forth between the two.  We find ourselves using Netflix the most for children's tv programs and movies.  For the price, this has been a great buy.  I would buy it again.

Reviews.Title: Apple TV exceeded my expectations
Reviews.Author: Jeffrey Schreier
Reviews.Content: Apple TV introduced me to some excellent web content like Vimeo, Simithsonian and Qello.  Only the latter was a paid subscription.  I also enjoy watching several other channels such such as the Wall Street Journal.  I also find watching movies to be easy.  Finally, I have an iPad and iPhone and the airplay mirroring which puts the screen content on your TV works very well.

Reviews.Title: Not as good as Roku but airplay makes up for it
Reviews.Author: booksandshoes
Reviews.Content: We disconnected our cable at the beginning of the year and haven't looked back. We have both Rokus and an Apple TV, with Netflix, Hulu and Amazon subs. The bad is the Apple TV is notably slower than the Roku and is missing Amazon Instant Video, but I still use the Apple TV more often because of airplay with my ipad which allows me to project nearly any video from the browser onto the TV. Korean dramas, anyone?If you don't have other Apple devices, go with the Roku. It's much better as a standalone product. If you do use other Apple products, the Apple TV fits right into your lineup.

Reviews.Title: Fun to Use
Reviews.Author: I. Nieto "ianieto"
Reviews.Content: We don't use the Apple TV with all of its potential yet.  We use it a lot for displaying photos and video from our iPads or iPhones using AirPlay.  Works quite well with that.  Displaying other picture albums is also fun to do.  A little disappointing when we try to project some apps from the iPad to the Apple TV and we get an error message that it is not supported.  I appears to be a licensing thing.  Apple TV is also nice for YouTube even though at times it "stalls" (YouTube waiting to download more content) when playing a selection and I am not sure if that is a problem with Apple TV or not but I don't think we saw as many stalls with our iPad 2 running on the same home network.  The one thing I should note is the YouTube app does not allow you to comment on YouTube videos after watching them like you can elsewhere.  I would suspect this was because with the tiny remote it would take forever to enter in a few sentences.  However, users can pair an Apple keyboard and that would work well for this.  Video through the many Apple TV apps are smooth even with my "slow" 3M DSL internet.  The unit is nice and compact and is extremely easy to set up when you first purchase it.  It is amazing how much you can do with a simple controlling remote but I would have preferred one with a few more buttons.  I would have given a 5 star rating if I didn't experience the YouTube stalls.  If this is a configuration issue, someone please note this and I will modify my rating.

Reviews.Title: Huge Apple Fan
Reviews.Author: Josh B.
Reviews.Content: I love the apple TV.  I mostly use it to stream my huge library of music, TV and movies over my local network.  However the web apps I have tried work  great too. Video quality and network streaming are excellent.

Reviews.Title: It Just Works!
Reviews.Author: JunkBMW
Reviews.Content: I purchased the Apple TV so I could wirelessly relay music from iPhones and MacBooks to the big stereo system in the living room. I'd used a wire before that, and besides all the hassle trying to hide it, it was picking up hum from the power lines. No such problems with the Apple TV, and as an added bonus we can also look at photos and watch movies from the iPhones and laptops, too. Even better, the Apple TV was actually less expensive than the Apple Express that would have relayed only music. I can't say much about using Netfilx and other streaming services as the data caps that come with our satellite Internet service don't really allow much traffic, but if there were any other Internet service available here I might consider dropping our satellite TV service.The only draw back is that it takes the Apple TV a little while to come on when power is first applied, but that would be a non-issue if it was powered with an always on outlet.

Reviews.Title: Good, but disappointed
Reviews.Author: Joel R
Reviews.Content: I bought this about the same time I bought a Roku Stick for a different TV.  The Apple TV was SUPER easy to setup with my iPhone (use bluetooth and it does everything for you).  It works fantastic as a Roku style device, streams Netflix etc beautifully and has optical and HDMI output etc.Disappointment comes from a couple of things.  Mostly Airplay.  Airplay is awesome and works perfect from an iOS device, but is very sub par on my macbook pro.  We have a variety of movies in various formats on my computer and I have had to do a lot of messing with my router to try and make playback watchable.  Streaming TV from a website for example is borderline watchable with the jumpiness.  its like I am getting 5fps instead of 30.  Sometimes if hangs for a half second or so.  Doesn't seem like a big deal until you are trying to watch a show and its so distracting!I also wish I could do the "private listening" that the Roku offers.  I have watched a couple shows while my wife sleeps and it would be epic if I could listen from my headphones rather than the speakers.  You can't do it however, even with apps etc on your phone that say you can (at least  that I have found so far).The Roku Stick couldn't even hook to my wifi.  I get an excellent signal (checked with Air Radar mac app) right in front of my TV but the Roku was terrible.  I sent it back.  I have a Roku 2 on the way (previous was the stick) I hope it works better....

Reviews.Title: Works as described.
Reviews.Author: Fred
Reviews.Content: This product works fine.  The case and remote are made well and of metal.  I also bought a ruku around the same time.  I like the quality of the Apple TV's case and remote, but the Ruku is easier to navigate.  The Apple remote was not designed for big fingers.  My students say they use their iphones and I touches to control their apple tv's - instead of the stock remote

Reviews.Title: Very versatile and useful; prefer it way over U-Verse and other cable/satellite services
Reviews.Author: Stan T.
Reviews.Content: I have to start with this preface: if you are choosing between an Apple TV, Roku, Chromecast, Amazon Fire, etc and you are already within the Apple Ecosystem, I'm 90% sure you will be most satisfied with the Apple TV.All of my electronic devices are on OS X or iOS. The Apple TV centralizes all of my devices. It connects and streams off my iTunes library and iTunes account. I use it for iTunes Radio as well, but can watch movies and listen to music straight from my computer (good thing because I'm tired of buying HDMI cables that stop working). Additionally, I love AirPlay. If I'm too lazy to go on the YouTube app or can't view something on the Apple TV (because there is not ATV app for it), then AirPlay will just throw it on the screen.That said, there are two things you should also consider that would actually make this thing useful: a good Wi-Fi connection and subscription to services like Netflix or HBO GO etc. The latter is not as important because I know a lot of people just use it to stream from their computer or use the free services that are included, but you can maximize how amazingly convenient this thing is through Netflix or HBO Go services and the like. But I can't stress the importance of Wi-Fi connection. If it's slow or unreliable, it will really diminish the enjoyment of this device.Another thing that I like? I can watch stuff on my own time and interest. I stopped watching TV years ago but I still see how people just mindlessly watch whatever is on, no choice and limited to time (even if they have DVR). Not only that, you don't have to pay $50 for like 4 channels you actually want and 600 others you don't care about. If you Netflix and other services can suffice your selection, you can either save money on entertainment subscriptions OR allocate some of those savings towards faster internet (and you'd probably still have some money left over for gas or food!).

Reviews.Title: Love it
Reviews.Author: Phillip S. Porter
Reviews.Content: I tried an android based dongle first, but disappointed when it could not mirror my ipad.  So, I broke down and got this.  I am very happy, airplay, and mirror work great, and quality of the image in HD is great.  Yes, the built in apps are limited, but truthfully, I only use Netflix, and YouTube and on occasion rent a movie from itunes, so I don't find this an issue.

Reviews.Title: You will love the experience
Reviews.Author: Matt from SD
Reviews.Content: After buying 4 units in the past 3 years I can honestly say "WOW". I've had every generation since the beginning (2007) and they seem to always get better while getting smaller in size. These little boxes are powerfull, full of features and potential. We use them all daily for watching movies and Netflix. The Netflix experience is like no other. It's really hard to buy the competition when Apple has mastered this invention. Looking forward to the future models as well.GO APPLE!

Reviews.Title: If you like Spanish or French audio option in movies you buy, this is the ONLY box.
Reviews.Author: Luis
Reviews.Content: As far as I know, iTunes is the ONLY one that provides alternative audio tracks for digital copies of movies or shows you can buy or rent. My children like Disney movies and many of them come with a Spanish or French audio track alternative.  I do wish Apple offered more movies and shows with this feature though. What I do not understand it that this is a standard feature on DVDs,  but not on digital copies. We are raising or children bilingual and because of this very simple but very important language feature for us, it is the main reason why I prefer the Apple TV over all the other alternatives.

Reviews.Title: Love it!
Reviews.Author: Rebecca D "elise72783"
Reviews.Content: I love the Apple TV.  I am asking myself why I didn't buy it sooner.  The ability to view the screen has been great for sharing information with my family.

Reviews.Title: We love all things Apple
Reviews.Author: Alison C.
Reviews.Content: We love all things Apple! So easy to use- so easy that our 4 year old can use it. Only wish it had an alphabet key, versus going through the whole alphabet to spell something out.

Reviews.Title: Its great.
Reviews.Author: Sebastian Zdarowski
Reviews.Content: This is a nice addition to the apple family. As long as you have a decent amount of apple gear you really do get a lot of use through this box. I can stream from my laptop and phone with ease. The connection sometimes does discount sometimes, and I wish apple would release an app store for this thing. But for a mere 100 dollars you turn your tv into a smart tv and is worth the investment if you are into apple and want an easy streaming experience.

Reviews.Title: If you own Apple products and don't have this it's a must have
Reviews.Author: Bunson
Reviews.Content: Makes things so much easier than playing anything from my phone.  I don't have to download my movies from ITunes anymore and I can get Netflix on it.  I thought it was a TV before until a friend showed us his.  Then we bought two.

Reviews.Title: Perfect
Reviews.Author: Amy June
Reviews.Content: So convenient and easy to use! Everyone should have one :)If you use Apple products, this is a a great way to stream.

Reviews.Title: Apple TV
Reviews.Author: rtd
Reviews.Content: Apple works great.  I play my own music on it that is loaded on iTunes.  I use my iPad as the controller.

Reviews.Title: Great Product and Great Price
Reviews.Author: Rick Malone
Reviews.Content: The was a great price for a quality product. The shipping was super fast as well. As I teacher I am using all of this to help better my classroom instruction. Thanks!

Reviews.Title: Love my Apple TV!
Reviews.Author: saradada
Reviews.Content: It's a great streaming device and I love it's compatibility with all things Apple. We own an iMac, MacBook, 2 iPads and 2 iPhones, so it was a natural choice. The mirroring function is fun and easy, and I love that it syncs with my iCloud photos. We use the photos as the screensaver. The only issue I have is that it doesn't play Amazon Prime videos. Sad Face. But we just play them on our iPad and mirror them to the TV. Problem solved.

Reviews.Title: I'm a fanboy
Reviews.Author: S. Justice
Reviews.Content: I love all my Apple products AND Microsoft as well.  Apple TV kicks the butt of all the other streaming devices including PS3, roku, and all others.  I stream from a recent year Netgear router in the $80 range and wirelessly with NO ISSUES and rarely any hiccups.  Netflix, PBS, HULU, and the dozen or so channels all perform flawlessly.

Reviews.Title: SAY GOODBYE TO CABLE AND SATELLITE
Reviews.Author: Jason
Reviews.Content: I love my Apple Tv I no longer pay for Cable, I watch all my content via Apple TV whether its from Netflix or YouTube I can watch it all! The future of entertainment is with streaming devices like the Apple Tv.

Reviews.Title: Great
Reviews.Author: Miriam Franklin
Reviews.Content: I love my Apple TV.  I wasn't sure how I would like it since I"m not into the fanciest electronics available but I love having Netflix available and only wish they had more of a movie library but that has nothing to do with my Apple TV.  It works great and I have not had any problems with it in the last few months.

Reviews.Title: great value and great product!
Reviews.Author: Omari Aarons
Reviews.Content: Apple products are easy to use and user intuitive. Apple TV doesn't disappoint! It hooks up easily with internet and fits seamlessly with my iPhone and Macbook.

Reviews.Title: Very fun
Reviews.Author: Review by, Producer "Life's short, use it well."
Reviews.Content: With Wi-Fi it's cool, but once you hook it up to a wired connection that's fast, it is a much better experience. Love it.

Reviews.Title: great for an Apple environment
Reviews.Author: Robin
Reviews.Content: The Apple TV works well. We like the AirPlay features that extend our iMac monitor to the TV. Our Roku does offer more channel options.

Reviews.Title: Great product.  Used, alot
Reviews.Author: tympanik
Reviews.Content: I have grown to love this product and how it integrates with my other apple products.  Is a consistent performer on a solid platform.  i am a cable cutter and this has been best tv product I own (I only wish Apple could integrate some skip-back functionality in the remote (not another button (but maybe a double-click left or right for a short skip back and a triple-click to skip back or forth, a chapter...just saying).Would highly recommend if a new version wasn't due out soon.  I also own a Roku 3, but the Apple TV is a much more polished product and has noticeably better image display properties.  (not to downplay the Roku 3, it's a fine product and I use that daily, as well.  It's image display is not unwatchable, but the AppleTV displays a much crisper image).

Reviews.Title: Great device for live streaming of your ipad/iphone screen!
Reviews.Author: Vertech
Reviews.Content: This is the 2nd Apple TV device I have purchased.  The first one I purchased to use at home to stream audio from iPhone to my home stereo along with streaming video/pictures from my iPad to my TV.  It worked so well that I bought another one for the office to connect to our 80" TV that we use in our conference room.  We have a lot of internal people with iPads and iPhones that want to show live content from their idevices that it seemed like a no brainer to hook this up.  We also get quite a few external people that show up to our office for meetings with idevices and want to show content on our screen, so again the Apple TV works great for allowing this to happen.A couple of things to note on this application of Apple TV.One, using AirPlay (the mechanism to connect to Apple TV from a iPad/iPhone) to "mirror" your screen to a display/tv will only happen in a 4:3 "like" format for the iPad and an even narrower format for iPhones.  So, if you have a wide screen display (i.e. 16:9 or 16:10) then you iPad screen mirror will only take up the center of the screen with black bars on each side.  The image will rotate along with the respective screen orientation of the iPad, so viewing the iPad in landscape mode will fill more of the screen but not all of the screen.  Not a big deal, just a comment.Two, some iPad/iPhone applications can stream directly to Apple TV in full screen mode without having to use AirPlay "screen mirroring", so you can fill your entire 16:9 wide screen.  For example the YouTube application can do this and fill the entire TV screen.And lastly, some ipad/iphone applications can deny your ability to use AirPlay to stream to your Apple TV.  For example, I was hoping my Xfinity application would allow me to stream movies to my TV but it told me I was not allowed to use AirPlay. :-(Just things to consider if you want to use the Apple TV for video streaming.  Streaming audio to your stereo system works great!  You need an optical digital input on your stereo to do this, so keep that in mind.  You can even stream music from your computer in iTunes over your network.  The Apply TV can connect to your network over Ethernet or WiFi.

Reviews.Title: Must have
Reviews.Author: Jay Brower
Reviews.Content: This is the future of TV.  simple to use, links to the apple ecosystem and conntect to (Netflix, HBO, Youtube)

Reviews.Title: Works every time!
Reviews.Author: strummer281
Reviews.Content: This is much better than my ROKU 2. It does not need to reload the movie like the ROKU. And I really like the playback of apps from my iPhone and iPad, it fills the screen and looks like a giant iPad, if the app is designed to do that like You Tube, any Apple app, Netflix (from iPad/iPhone), etc. Would recommend anyone with an i device to get this vs. the ROKU.

Reviews.Title: Apple TV rules!
Reviews.Author: MI
Reviews.Content: Excellent product.If you're thinking to buying one now, you might want to wait a few more days until Apple will announce/release the new version.

Reviews.Title: Awesome!
Reviews.Author: Brian Fitzpatrick
Reviews.Content: Great product, it's like having a computer on your tv. It's also works well if you have itunes. Inexspensive product.

Reviews.Title: Awesome
Reviews.Author: Mjr
Reviews.Content: If you are a fan of apple products, this works great. Very easy to connect and use. It is uses almost daily in my home.

Reviews.Title: A Good Product, but not yet perfect
Reviews.Author: Dave
Reviews.Content: If you are looking for a streaming box and use Apple products, the AppleTV is the way to go.  The processor is not the fastest in its class.  It doesn't offer the largest variety of channels (though there are rumors this will change in the near future).  But, if you have other Apple products (iPhone, iPad, laptop) you can use the Airplay feature to project whatever is one your device onto your TV through the AppleTV.This helps to cancel out the lack of channels.  The feature does not work in all instances.  There are certain apps that do not allow the use of Airplay (the March Madness app is one example).The Roku 3 has more channels and a faster processor, but it does not have an airplay feature.AppleTV also works best when connected via Ethernet as opposed to wi-fi.The appearance is small and discrete but requires sightline for the remote to work. Also, concerning the remote, if you have an Apple laptop the remote controls the volume on your laptop.  This may be an added bonus unless you are on your laptop and someone else is browsing through shows on the AppleTV.  Your volume will increase and decrease with the familiar *blip* each time.  This gets old quick.  I've given up on using my laptop and AppleTV in the same room unless I'm Airplay-ing something from my laptop.All-in-all it isn't bad.  Definitely worth it if you already use Apple products.  If you aren't an Apple user you're best suited to use a different product.

Reviews.Title: If your WiFi cuts out on your Netflix streaming viewing ... YOU NEED THIS
Reviews.Author: Kathy Gail
Reviews.Content: I'm no techno wizard but I can tell you this ... if you have a hard time with your WiFi connection while trying to view a streaming Netflix movie, this is what you need ... now that I've installed my Apple TV not one movie was interruped with annoying message "There's a problem with your Wifi connection, try try again".

Reviews.Title: Better than buying cable
Reviews.Author: Ada Castellon
Reviews.Content: I can watch Netflix and YouTube... TV is overrated. I can also mirror my I Phone which streams anything on the internet :D

Reviews.Title: Turn it off and you'll have to set it up again (frustrating )
Reviews.Author: Dennis F. Mercado "World W/O War"
Reviews.Content: Misses info if you turn it off. Bluetooth capability would be nice and give internet to TV too. Nice finish quality and color

Reviews.Title: Be sure of your specific needs before purchasing
Reviews.Author: Elizabeth "Elizabeth"
Reviews.Content: After purchasing a Roku 3 and Apple TV at the same time, I returned the Apple TV, although, in my opinion they are almost different devices and I could see a need to have both of them. The greatest thing about Apple TV is the wireless integration with an Apple phone or Tablet. As a streaming player however, I was not as impressed. I had both devices connected to different televisions in my home, so if I had a problem with one, I would go to the other and see if the same problem existed. On several occasions, the Apple Netflix would not connect (or would show an error) while the Roku connected every-time. Almost everything on the Apple requires a "subscription" (incurring additional costs) while the Roku offers many free viewing selections. (The food channels for recipes and the fitness channels for home workouts are awesome). Since Roku 3 allowed me to stream pictures, music and video from my apple devices, I made the final decision to send the Apple back. But with that being said, I do want to state again that I can see where it would be nice to actually have BOTH of these machines. Just be sure of your specific needs before you purchase is my advice.

Reviews.Title: Second time buying.
Reviews.Author: Steve D "Steve"
Reviews.Content: This is my 2nd Apple TV I have purchased, I was so happy with the first one that I bought a 2nd one so I could have multiples in my house. They are easily connected through my Wireless network and stream video in HD quality. It comes with a remote, but I have also configured my IPAD/IPhone to control it was well.This is a great product.

Reviews.Title: Changed our lives
Reviews.Author: Meg C. Kevane
Reviews.Content: Changed our lives.  Love that we can buy iTunes movies for the kids and have them all the time on apple tv.  No more scratched dvds.  We also use it to access Netflix.  The slideshow of pics from iPhoto when it is idle is also a big plus!

Reviews.Title: Another solid Appe product
Reviews.Author: E. Rucker
Reviews.Content: Who needs cable anymore? This is the future of television.  I'll never go back to cable where you get robbed every month. Easy set up and easy to use.

Reviews.Title: A million times yes!
Reviews.Author: dreamingviola
Reviews.Content: We have had this for almost 2 weeks now and I am ready to cancel my expensive cable.  It was SUPER easy to set up and now we have Hulu and Netflix and it pretty much covers all of the TV we were paying almost $200 a month for for less than $15 a month for those subscriptions.  Not to mention all of the other freebies on there.  It also ties into our iPad if we want to play something on any other apps that might not be on there.  I would definitely recommend this to anyone!

Reviews.Title: Great, but very behind the times.
Reviews.Author: yumyam
Reviews.Content: C'mon apple—I know you create supply and demand by keeping your tech behind the times. But, this most certainly does not follow Apple's design principle of providing the best user experience. It takes a million clicks going back and forth page to page to find what you want to watch. I'd rather have a larger, less minimal remote with more buttons if it means I don't have to click back and forth hundreds of times.And just a few weeks ago apple finally decided "Maybe users should have the ability to hide all the weird channels / providers that they don't ever use"

Reviews.Title: Limited Flexibility!
Reviews.Author: ACRA
Reviews.Content: I have two of these, they work very well although slow to go through the menu and options. The toughest thing about the Apple TV is you are at Apples mercy when it comes to updates at which time they may add one or two new channels, so it really is limited. They do not have Amazon Prime, so I recently purchased the ROKU 3 for that purpose.I guess it's about how you use a streaming device, I don't care about AirPlay; I don't listen to my iTunes on the TV, I don't care about having photos up and I don't rent / buy movies from iTunes. But if you do or like all that this is a five star unit. I just want Prime and maximum streaming options and flexibility, ROKU does that. So don't get me wrong it's like serving a beautifully prepared filet mignon to a vegan! The Apple is best if you; 1. own Apple devices and  2. use them in conjunction with the TV.The other issue I have is the remote has to be very close to the unit and nearly in front to change channels, very annoying. There is an App that takes the place of the remote, and that is certainly useful.Frankly with ROKU at the same price the  Apple doesn't make sense, it  is too limited and not flexible, I should be able to buy Apps the way I do on any Apple product. I cannot recommend.UPDATE: to be fair in reviewing this I am trying out the music channels and they are wonderful! Very surprising fidelity, excellent. Set it up through my receiver and the music reproduction is awesome. Again I continue to feel there are not enough APP options and flexibility compared to the ROKU, but I am among the converted when it comes to what it does offer. I will add I have it connected directly to the router, not WiFi so that helps.I continue to feel it is largely geared to Apple products users, and frankly if it had Prime I wouldn't feel the need for the ROKU. Since I have both I would say if you have to buy only one and want Prime, ROKU is not a compromise. If you don't have Prime and don't care and want the best in Audio/ Video reproduction quality Apple is the way to go.

Reviews.Title: Apple TV freaking rocks!
Reviews.Author: Matthew Gisonno
Reviews.Content: I love this Apple TV.  I bought it for my wife for Christmas, since she had been asking for it... She loves it, I love it, my son loves it, everyone that see's it loves it, etc!  I love that I can setup sharing and easily stream movies, music, pictures and more from our iTunes on any computer.  I also love that I can use my iPhone to share my screen from my phone right up onto my big screen TV, so I can easily show pictures to people that are over or anything else.  You can rent movies, it has a ton of free radio stations, I love watching YouTube or finding Disney stuff on YouTube for my kids.This thing is worth every penny!

Reviews.Title: we live in a digital ghetto
Reviews.Author: willie "roadie"
Reviews.Content: and this product provides a solution:video streaming from a main server to eliminate running new cabling in an older homewe live in a digital ghetto, surrounded by FIOS and high-speed cable - but we can only get less than 1Mbps DSL and wifi cellular connections are too expensivethis product provides a way for for us to stream movies and music from a stationary server in the house (an iMac) to our HDTVs placed around our home - and to do it wirelessly!very clean, very easy to set up:1. attach an AppleTV to each HDTV2. configure each to connect to your wifi router3. set up VNC (RDP) on your iMac4. sit in front of the desired TV5. initiate a VNC session from a netbook into your iMac (i use low-compression/quality settings which seem good enough)6. log in, then remotely select the desired AppleTV from the Finder's AirPlay menu7. launch VLC to play your movie8. eat popcornmost 'normal' AppleTV users will use their high-speed Internet to watch streams or info through a pay wall, but if you're like me and live in a digital ghetto, the AppleTV provides a way to conduct media sessions and enjoy entertainment in a closeted garden!

Reviews.Title: Awesome Device!
Reviews.Author: F. R. Cox "www.dc-8jet.com"
Reviews.Content: Like other things Apple this is easy to set up and use and works flawlessly.  The set up was super easy using my iPhone (or iPad) to touch the Apple TV and my user info. was transferred to it.

Reviews.Title: Very convenient.
Reviews.Author: James Fish
Reviews.Content: The first thing you will notice when you open your package is the distinct Apple quality packaging. Inside the box is the Apple TV unit itself, an AC power plug, a remote, an instruction manual, etc. All of the components included with this unit, including the unit itself, are very well made, rock solid, and scream quality. The setup of the Apple TV is also quite easy. Apple TV is WiFi compatible, but I opted to plug an ethernet cable into the back of it to ensure quick buffering times. It also utilizes HDMI, which is a nice feature for premium video quality. Pretty much this Apple TV acts as a gateway between your TV and all of your iTunes media on the same network, among other things. For instance, you can listen to music on your TV, watch iTunes purchased movies/TV shows on your TV, etc. The Apple TV can also access YouTube, Netflix, HBO GO, and many other useful "apps" which makes it a very compact media center pretty much. I would recommend Apple TV to anyone who makes purchases on iTunes, has a Netflix subscription, enjoys crystal clear YouTube videos on the big screen, etc.

Reviews.Title: easy peasy
Reviews.Author: stpilar
Reviews.Content: Apple TV is super easy to set up and use. I even move it from room to room every once in awhile, because it is no hassle to reconnect. The minimalist remote design is a plus for me.

Reviews.Title: THE best method to wean yourself from media providers (cable, DSL, satellite)!
Reviews.Author: Stephen L. Phillips "animal advocate"
Reviews.Content: Another milestone in my quest to replace ALL peripheral video services (ROKU, cable company, satellite, DSL) with internet based content streaming.Coupled with my Airport Extreme,  iPad 4 Retina, iPhone 4S, and soon-to-replace-cable-internet FIBER feed - I can access virtually ANY video streaming content source  and AirPlay to my plasma set!Amazon Prime, HULU+, Netflix, HBO-GO, major network apps - all play flawlessly through this compact, reliable device!

Reviews.Title: Enjoy using it
Reviews.Author: Winnie Hendricks
Reviews.Content: I luv using my Apple TV for watching netflix and other shows.  Very easy to install.  There another brand (roku), haven't had a chance to really see how it compares to Apple TV.

Reviews.Title: No clue why it is popular
Reviews.Author: DJO
Reviews.Content: I am running 18 mbs internet speed and still have constant issues with "cannot connect to itunes store", takes forever to load previews. I do not have issues like this at all with the 2 chromecasts I own. But, based on the overall reviews, there appear to be many that love this thing. I hate it!

Reviews.Title: Awesome!
Reviews.Author: Brian Daniel Miars
Reviews.Content: Easy to set up, easy to use. Looks sharp. I mainly purchased this to steam directly from my iPhone and iPad which works great.

Reviews.Title: Love it
Reviews.Author: sj
Reviews.Content: Easy to use. It's a fantastic product. Make sure to buy the hdmi cable with it. We like it so much we are going to get it for our other tvs

Reviews.Title: Enhances the utility of our TV
Reviews.Author: Old Cyclist
Reviews.Content: A small, simple (we old folks like simple), easy to use device that greatly enhances the utility of our TV.We are great fans of PBS, and Netflix subscribers.  Having the ability to access both thru our TV is very convenient, instead of trying to watch content on our iPads or sit in front of the computer.  We are not constrained to watch only what PBS is showing at the moment; we can watch the current programming at our convenience and access programs that we have missed.  I also like the ability to access my iTunes music library and play music thru the TV.  No doubt there are other features that I haven't discovered yet.I combined the Apple TV with a 5-port HDMI switch to simplify the setup and allow multiple devices to be played thru the TV without the need to change cables due the limited number of HDMI ports. The combination has greatly enhanced the simplicity of operation and our enjoyment of our entertainment system.

Reviews.Title: So cool!
Reviews.Author: Paul Fernando Mejía Benavides
Reviews.Content: I recommend this product absolutely! If you are an Apple user, you need to get this, belive me. I use it to reproduce my music and videos from my iMac to my living room's TV and Home Theater system. Features like Youtube and Netflix are simply cool.

Reviews.Title: Great for the price!
Reviews.Author: Anthony G.
Reviews.Content: This little device can do quite a bit.  Stream netflix/Hulu/other services, mirror apple devices, wireless second screen for OSX, and much more. Watch my review for more.[...]

Reviews.Title: The wireless remote is an advantage over ChromeCast
Reviews.Author: Steven N. Vaughn
Reviews.Content: I got this form my father hoping he would be able to work it easy. ChromeCast requires a smartphone really, which he doesn't have.

Reviews.Title: The usual Apple quality
Reviews.Author: DrBob
Reviews.Content: This TV wifi adapter performs well but has the usual somewhat quirky, intuitive but hard to navigate menu that seems to populate all Apple products.  It is a good option for an older flat screen that has HDMI inputs but no "smart" functions.  If  you have a smart-TV  you are advised to pass on this item unless you really must have an Apple interface.

Reviews.Title: Perfect for iOS devices
Reviews.Author: Jon McGuirt
Reviews.Content: I had an apple TV almost two years ago before I had internet at my home (yea, there was no point). A couple years went by and I acquired a few more Apple devices and found myself wanting to stream music wireless, watch TV shows without cable and use my TV to show other media during get togethers at my home. I debated between all the competitors to the Apple TV and highly considered Google chrome cast because of it's low price tag, but when it came down to it, the Apple TV is the best device of its kind for connecting your iOS device to your home entertainment setup. The Airplay feature made my decision since the other streaming devices relied on apps and not the actual iPhone, iPad, etc. I can mirror anything on my device and not just a tab or stream from just a certain app. My whole device can stream audio and video to my TV which is exactly what I wanted.It is limited on the amount of apps it has and while I thought mirroring my Macbook or iPad would be the same it wasn't. The aspect ratio of the device is transferred to the TV. This isn't an issue with the Macbook, but who wants to relax and watch something using your computer to control it?! The iPad and iPhone create odd black space around the video which isn't ideal.Overall I'm very satisfied and although there's rumors of a new version coming out very soon I was excited to have this device and at the discounted price offered by Amazon.

Reviews.Title: A must have .
Reviews.Author: E Miranda
Reviews.Content: It work with all my family's iPhone as well as my iPad 2. I have teenagers and they enjoy using it to watch their music videos or YouTube . Very clear and crisp viewing in our tv.

Reviews.Title: If you want to use Airplay, Airplay mirroring, or iCloud photo sharing get this, otherwise you may want to consider a Roku
Reviews.Author: Wolf Island Diver
Reviews.Content: I got this for 2 reasons. 1st my Sony str-dn840 has airplay but uses an awful high contrast graphical display with no screen saver that burns and image into my plasma tv. The Apple TV's Airplay playing capability is better. It allows browsing from its gui of networked shared libraries, and it has a nice screen saver. 2nd, the Apple tv allows for Airplay mirroring and iCloud photo sharing. This allows you to easily watch videos taken on your iDevice on the big screen, or view your iDevice photos saved to iCloud. Yes, you can do this with any tv or blu-ray player with HDMI and a Apple AV cable. However, the proprietary cable costs $50 and the Apple TV costs $85. To me its a no-brainer to by the Apple TV for this use case for an additional $35.Of course all of this assumes you are already heavily invested in the Apple universe with iPhones, iPads, Macs and iTunes, and care about watching iPhone videos and photos on your TV. There is another issue as well. Apple is a content provider though iTunes. They really don't compete with Netflix, as they don't provide a subscription service, so you get that, but they do compete with Amazon for movie rentals, so you don't get an Amazon app. You still need another device to use your Prime streaming or rent movies from Amazon which are cheaper than iTunes. Roku on the other hand isn't an Amazon competitor, so you get Prime along with many more streaming services.Performance wise, the Apple TV has plenty of storage so that buffering and streaming quality don't seem to be an issue. Also the Apple TV has some other potential. They do add content, and there is word that Apple with update the software with more app store-like functionality, so that developers can make apps for it. We'll see. For now its a good unobtrusive player, with Apple universe integration and less content than Roku or XBMC. Well, that is, unless they develop an Apple TV 3 jailbreak.One more thing. Airplay mirroring ONLY natively works with newer Macs with better graphics hardware and iOS devices. To use AIrplay mirroring on older Macs you need to buy the AirParrot app. I can attest that this works well on a ram upgraded late 2008 MBP, but it does use a lot of system resources and spins up the fan quite a bit.

Reviews.Title: Love my Apple TV
Reviews.Author: Brian M. Kaplan "Brian M. Kaplan"
Reviews.Content: I have this and a few Roku players around the house. I mainly bought this because I wanted to hook it to my stereo so I could airplay my music directly from my iphone or Ipad. It works great and uses a digital output cable for the sound (sold separately). I do use it to stream Netflix and just noticed that Apple included some free channels like the Red Bull and Smithsonian channels where you can watch some cool stuff.

Reviews.Title: Apple TV MD199ll/a
Reviews.Author: Louie
Reviews.Content: I did a lot of researches online, and read a lot of reviews before I decided to give this small black box a try.  This Apple TV does notdisappoint me. It's easy to setup, and easy to use; I can use either my iPhone or my ipad to play movies on big screen HD TV's byusing "Air Play".

Reviews.Title: Awesome
Reviews.Author: Charles
Reviews.Content: Best tech buy I've made in years. This thing is super cool. Many apps for many diff tv/movies. And the airplay to stream music or video to any connected device is clutch.

Reviews.Title: I love the Apple TV
Reviews.Author: gunnar
Reviews.Content: I just recently bought the Apple TV and have used it for Netflix and for streamingof the Winter Olympics events. It works very well so far and I would highly recommend it to others !!

Reviews.Title: I'm pretty impressed!
Reviews.Author: Ohio dude "Big guy"
Reviews.Content: The big reason I bought the Apple TV was for YouTube.  It was either Apple TV or Roku 3, although I heard about a Western Digital device but I don't know much about it.  I have had many Roku devices and they've all worked fine, but I thought I'd try Apple TV for a change.  I have recently changed over to Apple Ipads and laptops so I thought I'd give it a try.  Well, from my first few hours with it I'm quite impressed!  The YouTube set up is awesome!  The picture is great, the menu works fine, and I couldn't be more impressed. And, YouTube has SO much great content!  You can find just about everything on YouTube, documentaries, full music albums, sermons, speeches, how to videos, movie clips, you name it and it's probably on YouTube!  And I have the Roku2 with all it's supposedly great channels.  But you know what I use it for?  Netflix, Amazon, and Vudu.  That's it!  Crackle sucks, it has commercials, and PBS is cool but it's on Apple TV as well.  The other thing I liked about Apple TV was the Airplay connection where you can stream from your MacBook, Imac, Ipad, or cell phone to your TV.  I tried it with a MacBook and it couldn't be more simple!  I streamed some Coursera courses on it from my Macbook, and it worked flawlessly!  The Neflix interface is a little snazzier on the Apple TV, a little more slick and prettier than the Roku.  The one thing I don't really like that much is the Apple TV Remote.  It's kind of hard to get used to, I was always pushing the middle button accidently when scrolling.  It's also very small and about 1/8" thick and I wonder when I'm going to sit on it and break it.Other than that, like I said, I'm VERY impressed!  I'm glad I got the Apple TV instead of the Roku 3 which people seem to be having problems with.  But, I also kept my Roku2 and use it along side the Apple TV.  You just have to make sure you have a few HDMI slots on the back of your TV, which most TV's do have nowadays.  The Apple TV also is a nice piece of technology.  It is a lot heavier than the Roku, and doesn't seem "plasticky" like the Roku, but more like a solid hockey puck.  It's as easy to set up as it is to get a laptop hooked into your network, doesn't take 5 minutes.  All in all I'm impressed with the feel of the device, the interface is typical Apple cool, and everything works exactly as you would want it to.  What more can you ask for?

Reviews.Title: Great of you have other Apple products.
Reviews.Author: Bill Bardin
Reviews.Content: I bought this for two main reasons. I wanted to add it to an old plasma TV that has no built in apps so I could watch Netflix and I wanted to be able to use all my other Apple products with it. Works seamlessly. It's a little dated given the features on the new Roku products but it does everything I need. I paired an Apple wireless keyboard to it so I don't have to chase letters all over the screen when searching for things. It works great too.

Reviews.Title: A good option for Ipad display, Itunes on your TV, and streaming video/audio
Reviews.Author: Lawrence H. Ganders "Larry"
Reviews.Content: I originally sought Apple TV as a way to display Ipad Mini on a monitor/television using Air Play without a relatively costly hardwire connection (The Apple adapter alone is $60.)  I wanted to show videos and slide presentations loaded on the mini Ipad to a larger television screen. This gave me that capability but also is a great way to access photos and ITunes music playlists through my home network (As long ITunes is up and running on the Windows 7 PC in my home office).  Thirdly, it's a very good way to access streaming video applications such as Netflix or Hulu. The streaming capability seems to produce better sound and picture clarity than my Sony Blue Ray DVD players or PS3 with less buffering.  I hooked Apple TV through my Bose home theater system (which even had a setup expressly for Apple TV). Apple TV produces Dolby 5.1 surround sound through my Bose system quite nicely. It seems like a cost-effective way to add service to a television in that part of the house where you don't have cable or satellite television service connections.The main down side is that many of the applications do require that you have a service such as Direct TV or Xfinity somewhere in the house.  And you will need a home wireless internet network. Hulu Plus, HBO Go, and Pandora are now among many services offered by Apple TV, so there's a nice variety of applications available, some requiring subscriptions service (such as Netflix) or service from a tv provider (such as ABC, Disney, and HBO Go applications.) Regrettably, Apple TV does not offer an Amazon Prime Application.

Reviews.Title: What's not to love?
Reviews.Author: psacks
Reviews.Content: If you have an iMac, MacBook, iPad, or iPhone and you use iTunes, then the Apple TV is an invaluable addition. Hook it up to your tv and stereo and you can rent movies, stream music and movies from your computer or iDevice, and even mirror your display to your tv via Airplay. Netflix, Hulu, YouTube, HBO Go, and a slew of other channels round out an all around wonderful device. Easy to hookup and get running, like all of Apple's products.

Reviews.Title: Great media choice for people who are invested in the iTunes and Apple ecosystem
Reviews.Author: Joe Dodge
Reviews.Content: My family is part of the emerging trend of 'cutting the cord', we get all of our media through the internet.We subscribe to Netflix and Hulu and get the other shows my wife enjoys through the 'Season pass' subscriptions offered in iTunes.If you buy all of your music and video from iTunes, this is really the only easy way to get that content on the big screen. Setup is easy but takes a while, because entering your passwords and usernames is painful on the included remote. Apple provides an App for iPhone that is a must-download, it really makes navigating the Apple TV faster.The Apple TV comes with several apps. The only problem is that many of them, like HBO GO, require a cable subscription and HBO service. The PBS app works without a cable subscription, as does the Bloomberg and Sky News apps. There is not an Amazon Prime app, unfortunately.AirPlay, an Apple technology that lets you stream your screen contents from your OS X device or iOS device (iPad,iPhone), works flawlessly, I could see it being useful for presentations on TVs and it's a great way to share what you're doing on your computer with the family. Again, as with most Apple things, it only works with Apple devices.

Reviews.Title: another great apple product
Reviews.Author: Eric J. Bauer
Reviews.Content: best feature is airplay. I watch a lot of netflix, so i just use the netflix app on my iPad and stream it to the apple tv. Not only does it play full HD but i can still browse around on the iPad while watching.

Reviews.Title: Great way for all your viewing needs
Reviews.Author: Anson
Reviews.Content: I received this as a gift and at first thought didn't think I would use it much. On opening the box and setting it up (very easy to set up) this became my primary way of watching shows. I have an older tv that doesn't have netflix or other apps built in. However, t ended up getting rid of my cable because I am able to watch hulu and netflix, and use the Airplay to stream any other shows I have. I think considered getting a Roku as they are reputable as well. However, with me having an iPhone, iPad and MacBook Pro, it's a no brainer of having the Apple TV to work seamlessly with all other Apple products. It excels extremely well at this. Being able to mirror whatever on my iPhone or iPad is one of the best features of the Apple TV. Definitely a great product, very satisfied customer!

Reviews.Title: Apple is great
Reviews.Author: Brian & Kim French "French Family"
Reviews.Content: I haven't met an apple product I didn't like. This is a seamless product. The only thing to note is that if you want to connect it to your surround sound is that you need and optical cable and input on your stereo or an adapter. Doesn't cost a whole lot to get that set up. But worth mentioning

Reviews.Title: Had one at home, finally decided to get a 2nd to take when I travel.
Reviews.Author: T. Johnston "tej2"
Reviews.Content: I hadn't been able to get one of these to work in hotels before, but now that I have a hotspot through my 4G LTE phone (with unlimited data), I can use this just like I do at home.  Great to have the options to watch Netflix, MLB.TV, HBO-Go, ESPN WatchNow, etc. when I'm away from home.

Reviews.Title: I love it!
Reviews.Author: Christine L. Wolf
Reviews.Content: I wish I had one years ago. This is so convenient for me when I want to watch Netflix. I used to have to go thru the wii game console  to do that but it's easier, quicker and simple to access with Apple TV. I also watch a lot of HBO and again, much easier than going thru the comcast tuner. I really enjoy using my lolo exercise apps on it too! This works with my iPhone which has "airplay" and when I turn on the "mirror" switch, the lolo app will display on the tv screen! The Apple tv is super easy to set up, and if I misplace the remote that comes with it, I can use my iPhone as a remote!!
